--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveStateEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveStateEnum ---
# ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveStateEnum
`enum ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveStateEnum : ClusterEnum`
The state of the valve.
### Enum Values
*   `Closed`: Valve is in closed position.
*   `Open`: Valve is in open position.
*   `Transitioning`: Valve is transitioning between closed and open positions or between levels.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
### Properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.PressureMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/PressureMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
# PressureMeasurementTrait.Attributes
`interface PressureMeasurementTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the PressureMeasurement cluster.
### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `featureMap: PressureMeasurementTrait.Feature`: Optional cluster features supported.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
*   `maxMeasuredValue: Short?`: Maximum pressure value that can be measured (in kPa * 10).
*   `maxScaledValue: Short?`: Maximum measurable value of `scaledValue` (in Pascals).
*   `measuredValue: Short?`: Pressure in kPa, calculated at 10 times the pressure value.
*   `minMeasuredValue: Short?`: Minimum pressure value that can be measured (in kPa * 10).
*   `minScaledValue: Short?`: Minimum measurable value of `scaledValue` (in Pascals).
*   `scale: Byte?`: Base 10 exponent used to calculate `scaledValue`.
*   `scaledTolerance: UShort?`: Possible error range around `scaledValue`.
*   `scaledValue: Short?`: Pressure in Pascals, using the `scale` exponent.
*   `tolerance: UShort?`: Magnitude of possible error associated with `measuredValue`.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.KeypadInputTrait.Feature ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/KeypadInputTrait.Feature ---
# KeypadInputTrait.Feature
`data class KeypadInputTrait.Feature`
KeypadInput cluster FeatureMap.
### Constructor
*   `Feature(navigationKeyCodes: Boolean, locationKeys: Boolean, numberKeys: Boolean)`
### Function
*   `toRaw(): ULong`: Convert this ClusterBitmap to raw (bytes) format.
### Properties
*   `locationKeys: Boolean`: Supports CEC keys `0x0A` (Settings) and `0x09` (Home).
*   `navigationKeyCodes: Boolean`: Supports UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, SELECT, BACK, EXIT, and MENU keys.
*   `numberKeys: Boolean`: Supports numeric input keys from 0 through 9.
*   `bitmapName: String`: Name of the Matter bitmap.
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.MediaPlaybackCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/MediaPlaybackCommands ---
# MediaPlaybackCommands
`interface MediaPlaybackCommands`
### Functions
*   `activateAudioTrack(trackId: String, audioOutputIndex: UByte): suspend Unit`
*   `activateTextTrack(trackId: String): suspend Unit`
*   `deactivateTextTrack(): suspend Unit`
*   `fastForward(optionalArgs: ...): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.FastForwardCommand.Response`: Fast forward the current media.
*   `next(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.NextCommand.Response`: Move to the next item in the media.
*   `pause(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.PauseCommand.Response`: Pause the current media.
*   `play(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.PlayCommand.Response`: Play the current media.
*   `previous(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.PreviousCommand.Response`: Move to the previous item in the current media.
*   `rewind(optionalArgs: ...): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.RewindCommand.Response`: Rewind the current media.
*   `seek(position: ULong): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.SeekCommand.Response`: Change the playback position.
*   `skipBackward(deltaPositionMilliseconds: ULong): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.SkipBackwardCommand.Response`: Skip backward by a specified amount of time.
*   `skipForward(deltaPositionMilliseconds: ULong): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.SkipForwardCommand.Response`: Skip forward by a specified amount of time.
*   `startOver(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.StartOverCommand.Response`: Start over from the beginning.
*   `stop(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.StopCommand.Response`: Stop playing the current media.
*(All functions also have a `...Batchable(...)` version that returns a `BatchableCommand`)*

# RvcOperationalStateTrait.OperationalStateEnum
`enum RvcOperationalStateTrait.OperationalStateEnum : ClusterEnum`
The operational states.
### Enum Values
*   `Charging`: The device is charging.
*   `Docked`: The device is on the dock, not charging.
*   `Error`
*   `Paused`
*   `Running`
*   `SeekingCharger`: The device is en route to the charging dock.
*   `Stopped`
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
### Properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.

# OnOffTrait.StartUpOnOffEnum
`enum OnOffTrait.StartUpOnOffEnum : ClusterEnum`
Startup behaviors for a device.
### Enum Values
*   `Off`: Sets the `onOff` attribute to false on startup.
*   `On`: Sets the `onOff` attribute to true on startup.
*   `Toggle`: Toggles the `onOff` attribute on startup based on its previous value.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.

# EnergyEvseTrait.EnergyTransferStopped
`interface EnergyEvseTrait.EnergyTransferStopped`
Notification that the electric vehicle has stopped charging or discharging.
### Properties
*   `energyDischarged: Long?`
*   `energyTransferred: Long?`: Energy transferred (mWh) since `EnergyTransferStarted`. Positive for charging, negative for discharging.
*   `reason: EnergyEvseTrait.EnergyTransferStoppedReasonEnum?`: The reason for stopping the energy transfer.
*   `sessionId: UInt?`: The `sessionId` attribute value prior to the event.
*   `state: EnergyEvseTrait.StateEnum?`: The `state` attribute value prior to the event.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.FanControlTrait.FanModeEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/FanControlTrait.FanModeEnum ---
# FanControlTrait.FanModeEnum
`enum FanControlTrait.FanModeEnum : ClusterEnum`
Specifies the current fan mode.
### Enum Values
*   `Auto`: The fan is using an auto speed.
*   `High`: The fan is using a high speed.
*   `Low`: The fan is using a low speed.
*   `Medium`: The fan is using a medium speed.
*   `Off`: The fan is off.
*   `On`: The fan is on.
*   `Smart`: The Smart mode for the fan.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
### Properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.

# interface ModeSelectTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the ModeSelect cluster.
### Properties
| Name | Type | Description |
|---|---|---|
| `acceptedCommandList` | `val acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` | A list of supported client-generated commands. |
| `attributeList` | `val attributeList: List<UInt>` | A list of supported attribute IDs. |
| `clusterRevision` | `val clusterRevision: UShort` | The revision of the server cluster specification. |
| `currentMode` | `val currentMode: UByte?` | The current mode of a cluster instance. **Access type:** Read |
| `description` | `val description: String?` | Describes the purpose of the mode. **Access type:** Read |
| `featureMap` | `val featureMap: ModeSelectTrait.Feature` | Optional cluster features supported by the server. |
| `generatedCommandList` | `val generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` | A list of supported server-generated commands. |
| `onMode` | `val onMode: UByte?` | The value of `currentMode` that depends on the state of an `OnOff` cluster. **Access type:** Write |
| `standardNamespace` | `val standardNamespace: UShort?` | The single standard namespace for any standard semantic tag value. **Access type:** Read |
| `startUpMode` | `val startUpMode: UByte?` | The desired startup mode for the device. **Access type:** Write |
| `supportedModes` | `val supportedModes: List<ModeSelectTrait.ModeOptionStruct>?` | The list of supported modes. **Access type:** Read |

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.SwitchTrait.MultiPressComplete ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/SwitchTrait.MultiPressComplete ---
# interface SwitchTrait.MultiPressComplete
Indicates how many times the momentary switch has been pressed in a multi-press sequence.
### Properties
*   `previousPosition: UByte?`: The value of the `currentPosition` attribute just prior to the release.
*   `totalNumberOfPressesCounted: UByte?`: Valid values are:
    *   `1`: One press, sequence ended (not a multiple-press).
    *   `2`: Exactly two presses, sequence ended.
    *   `3`: Exactly three presses, sequence ended.
    *   `_n_`: Exactly _n_ presses, sequence ended.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.PresetStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.PresetStruct ---
# class ThermostatTrait.PresetStruct : ClusterStruct
A preset.
### Constructors
*   `PresetStruct(presetHandle: ByteArray?, presetScenario: ThermostatTrait.PresetScenarioEnum, name: OptionalValue<String?>, coolingSetpoint: OptionalValue<Short>, heatingSetpoint: OptionalValue<Short>, builtIn: Boolean?)`: Creates the PresetStruct class.
### Functions
*   `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor`: Returns the descriptor for the struct.
*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`: Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.
### Properties
*   `builtIn: Boolean?`: Indicates whether the preset is built-in (can be modified but not deleted).
*   `coolingSetpoint: OptionalValue<Short>`: The cooling setpoint for the preset.
*   `heatingSetpoint: OptionalValue<Short>`: The heating setpoint for the preset.
*   `name: OptionalValue<String?>`: A user-provided name.
*   `presetHandle: ByteArray?`: A device generated identifier for this preset.
*   `presetScenario: ThermostatTrait.PresetScenarioEnum`: The associated `PresetScenarioEnum` value for this preset.

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ActionsTrait.ActionTypeEnum ---
# enum ActionsTrait.ActionTypeEnum
Action types.
### Enum Values
*   `Alarm`: Higher priority notification.
*   `Automation`: Control an automation (e.g., motion-activated lights).
*   `Exception`: A sequence of commands that runs when the expected does not happen.
*   `Notification`: Send a message to the user.
*   `Other`: Use only when no other value applies.
*   `Scene`: Set the endpoints to a predetermined state.
*   `Sequence`: A sequence of states with a specific time pattern.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.

### `data class` ColorControlTrait.Feature
ColorControl cluster FeatureMap.
#### Constructor
*   `Feature(hueAndSaturation: Boolean = false, enhancedHue: Boolean = false, colorLoop: Boolean = false, xy: Boolean = false, colorTemperature: Boolean = false)` - Creates the Feature data class.
#### Public Functions
*   `toRaw(): ULong` - Convert this ClusterBitmap to raw (bytes) format.
#### Public Properties
*   `bitmapName`: `String` - Name of the Matter bitmap, in UpperCamelCase, e.g. "OnOffControlBitmap" from OnOff Cluster.
*   `colorLoop`: `Boolean` - Supports color loop.
*   `colorTemperature`: `Boolean` - Supports specification of color temperature.
*   `enhancedHue`: `Boolean` - Supports enhanced hue.
*   `hueAndSaturation`: `Boolean` - Supports color specification via hue and saturation.
*   `traitId`: `String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap Data Type.
*   `xy`: `Boolean` - Supports color specification via XY.

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/FanControlTrait.RockBitmap ---
### `data class` FanControlTrait.RockBitmap
The current active fan rocking motion setting.
#### Constructor
*   `RockBitmap(rockLeftRight: Boolean = false, rockUpDown: Boolean = false, rockRound: Boolean = false)` - Creates the RockBitmap data class.
#### Public Functions
*   `toRaw(): ULong` - Convert this ClusterBitmap to raw (bytes) format.
#### Public Properties
*   `bitmapName`: `String` - Name of the Matter bitmap, in UpperCamelCase, e.g. "OnOffControlBitmap" from OnOff Cluster.
*   `rockLeftRight`: `Boolean` - The fan is using a rock left to right setting.
*   `rockRound`: `Boolean` - The fan is using a rock around setting.
*   `rockUpDown`: `Boolean` - The fan is using a rock up and down setting.
*   `traitId`: `String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap Data Type.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DishwasherModeTrait.ModeTagStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DishwasherModeTrait.ModeTagStruct ---
### `class` DishwasherModeTrait.ModeTagStruct
Describes a mode tag. The same manufacturer code and mode tag value in separate cluster instances are part of the same namespace and have the same meaning.
#### Constructor
*   `ModeTagStruct(mfgCode: OptionalValue<UShort> = OptionalValue.absent(), value: UShort)` - Creates the ModeTagStruct class.
#### Public Functions
*   `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor` - Returns the descriptor for the struct.
*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?` - Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.
#### Public Properties
*   `mfgCode`: `OptionalValue<UShort>` - The manufacturer's vendor ID.
*   `value`: `UShort` - The mode tag within a mode tag namespace. If the `mfgCode` field exists, this is set to a manufacturer-defined value, otherwise, it's set to a standard value.

### `object` DoorLockTrait.GetWeekDayScheduleCommand
Retrieve the weekly schedule for the specified user. Week day schedules are used to restrict access to a specified time window on certain days of the week. The schedule is repeated each week.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.FanControlTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/FanControlTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface` FanControlTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the FanControl cluster.
#### Public Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `airflowDirection`: `FanControlTrait.AirflowDirectionEnum?`
*   `attributeList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
*   `clusterRevision`: `UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `fanMode`: `FanControlTrait.FanModeEnum?` - The current speed mode of the fan. **Access type:** Write
*   `fanModeSequence`: `FanControlTrait.FanModeSequenceEnum?` - The supported fan speed ranges. **Access type:** Read
*   `featureMap`: `FanControlTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `percentCurrent`: `UByte?` - The actual currently operating fan speed, or `0` to indicate that the fan is off. **Access type:** Read
*   `percentSetting`: `UByte?` - The speed setting for the fan. **Access type:** Write
*   `rockSetting`: `FanControlTrait.RockBitmap?` - A bitmap that indicates the current active fan rocking motion settings. **Access type:** Write
*   `rockSupport`: `FanControlTrait.RockBitmap?` - A bitmap that indicates what rocking motions the server supports. **Access type:** Read
*   `speedCurrent`: `UByte?` - The actual currently operating fan speed, or `0` to indicate that the fan is off. **Access type:** Read
*   `speedMax`: `UByte?` - The fan speed (value of `1`) or the maximum speed, if the fan is capable of multiple speeds. **Access type:** Read
*   `speedSetting`: `UByte?` - The speed setting for the fan. **Access type:** Write
*   `windSetting`: `FanControlTrait.WindBitmap?` - A bitmap that indicates the current active fan wind feature settings. **Access type:** Write
*   `windSupport`: `FanControlTrait.WindBitmap?` - A bitmap that indicates what wind modes the server supports. **Access type:** Read

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CostStruct ---
### `DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CostStruct`
A class that indicates a generic mechanism for expressing the cost to run an appliance.
#### **Constructor**
*   `CostStruct(costType: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CostTypeEnum, value: Int, decimalPoints: UByte, currency: OptionalValue<UShort>)`
#### **Properties**
*   `costType: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CostTypeEnum`: The type of cost being represented.
*   `currency: OptionalValue<UShort>`: The currency for the value, matching ISO 4217.
*   `decimalPoints: UByte`: The number of digits to the right of the decimal point in the `value` field.
*   `value: Int`: The value of the cost. A positive number is a cost, a negative number is a benefit.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.ControlSequenceOfOperationEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.ControlSequenceOfOperationEnum ---
### `enum ThermostatTrait.ControlSequenceOfOperationEnum`
The system modes that the thermostat can operate in.
#### **Enum Values**
*   `CoolingAndHeating`: All modes are possible.
*   `CoolingAndHeatingWithReheat`: Cool and precooling modes are not possible.
*   `CoolingOnly`: Heat and emergency modes are not possible.
*   `CoolingWithReheat`: Heat and emergency modes are not possible.
*   `HeatingOnly`: Cool and precooling modes are not possible.
*   `HeatingWithReheat`: Cool and precooling modes are not possible.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OnOffTrait.DelayedAllOffEffectVariantEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OnOffTrait.DelayedAllOffEffectVariantEnum ---
### `enum OnOffTrait.DelayedAllOffEffectVariantEnum`
Delayed fading effects for lighting.
#### **Enum Values**
*   `DelayedOffFastFade`: Lights fade off in 0.8 seconds.
*   `DelayedOffSlowFade`: Lights dim to 50% in 0.8 seconds, then fade off in 12 seconds.
*   `NoFade`: Lights do not fade.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.PresetScenarioEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.PresetScenarioEnum ---
### `enum ThermostatTrait.PresetScenarioEnum`
Preset Scenarios for a thermostat.
#### **Enum Values**
*   `GoingToSleep`: Users are likely to be going to sleep.
*   `Occupied`: The thermostat-controlled area is occupied.
*   `Sleep`: Users are likely to be sleeping.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
*   `Unoccupied`: The thermostat-controlled area is unoccupied.
*   `UserDefined`: Custom presets.
*   `Vacation`: Users are on vacation.
*   `Wake`: Users are likely to be waking up.

- `NoError`: The device is not in an error state.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
# interface Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the Pm10ConcentrationMeasurement cluster.
### Properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
- `averageMeasuredValue: Float?`: The average value of `measuredValue` over the `averageMeasuredValueWindow`.
- `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: The window of time, in seconds, used to determine the `averageMeasuredValue`.
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.
- `featureMap: Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature`: Indicates support for optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `levelValue: Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.LevelValueEnum?`: The level of the substance detected.
- `maxMeasuredValue: Float?`: The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
- `measuredValue: Float?`: The most recent measurement in units specified by `measurementUnit`.
- `measurementMedium: Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?`: The medium in which `measuredValue` is being measured.
- `measurementUnit: Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?`: The unit used by `measuredValue`.
- `minMeasuredValue: Float?`: The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
- `peakMeasuredValue: Float?`: The maximum value of `measuredValue` measured during the `peakMeasuredValueWindow`.
- `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: The window of time, in seconds, for determining the `peakMeasuredValue`.
- `uncertainty: Float?`: The range of error or deviation in `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValueWindow`.

- `DeviceTypeStruct(deviceType: UInt, revision: UShort)`

- `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor`
- `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`
### Properties
- `deviceType: UInt`: The device type definition.
- `revision: UShort`: The implemented revision of the device type definition.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.Attributes ---
# interface OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestor cluster.
### Properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.
- `defaultOtaProviders: List<OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.ProviderLocation>?`: A list of available OTA providers.
- `featureMap: UInt`: Indicates support for optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `updatePossible: Boolean?`: `true` indicates that the OTA requestor can be updated.
- `updateState: OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum?`: The current state of the OTA requestor regarding software updates.
- `updateStateProgress: UByte?`: The progress of the update as a percentage.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControl ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControl ---
### `interface ColorControl`
API for the ColorControl trait, providing an interface for changing the color of a light. It implements `ColorControlTrait.Attributes`, `MatterTrait`, `Updatable`, and `ColorControlCommands`.
#### **Nested Types**
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Command`: Descriptor for this trait's commands.
#### **Public Functions**
*   `supports(attribute: ColorControl.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: ColorControl.Command): Boolean`
#### **Public Property**
*   `factory: TraitFactory<ColorControl>`
#### **Inherited Members**
*   **Commands**: Inherits numerous commands from `ColorControlCommands` for color manipulation, such as `moveToHue`, `stepColor`, `colorLoopSet`, `moveColorTemperature`, and their batchable versions.
*   **Attributes**: Inherits a comprehensive set of attributes from `ColorControlTrait.Attributes`, including `currentHue`, `currentSaturation`, `colorTemperatureMireds`, `colorMode`, `featureMap`, and many others related to color state and capabilities.
*   **Functions**: Inherits `update()` from `Updatable` for mutation and `forceRead()` from `TraitStateInvalidation`.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.StepColorCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.StepColorCommand.Request ---
### `ColorControlTrait.StepColorCommand.Request`
A class representing the request payload for the `StepColor` command.
#### **Constructor**
*   `Request(stepX: Short, stepY: Short, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: OptionsBitmap)`
#### **Properties**
*   `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden.
*   `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in the `options` attribute based on `optionsMask`.
*   `stepX: Short`: The change to be added to the device's `currentX` attribute.
*   `stepY: Short`: The change to be added to the device's `currentY` attribute.
*   `transitionTime: UShort`: The time (in 0.1s) to move to the new color.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ChannelCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ChannelCommands ---
### `interface ChannelCommands`
An interface defining commands for channel manipulation.
#### **Public Functions**
*   `cancelRecordProgram(...)`: Cancels a program recording.
*   `cancelRecordProgramBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `cancelRecordProgram`.
*   `changeChannel(match: String)`: Changes to the specified channel. Returns `ChannelTrait.ChangeChannelCommand.Response`.
*   `changeChannelBatchable(match: String)`: Batchable version of `changeChannel`.
*   `changeChannelByNumber(majorNumber: UShort, minorNumber: UShort)`: Changes channel by ATSC major/minor number.
*   `changeChannelByNumberBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `changeChannelByNumber`.
*   `getProgramGuide(...)`: Retrieves the program guide. Returns `ChannelTrait.GetProgramGuideCommand.Response`.
*   `getProgramGuideBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `getProgramGuide`.
*   `recordProgram(...)`: Records a program.
*   `recordProgramBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `recordProgram`.
*   `skipChannel(count: Short)`: Jumps up or down a number of channels.
*   `skipChannelBatchable(count: Short)`: Batchable version of `skipChannel`.

*   Fault interfaces (`AirDetection`, `DryRunning`, `Leakage`, `GeneralFault`, etc.)

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/IdentifyCommands ---
### `interface IdentifyCommands`
An interface defining commands for device identification.
#### **Public Functions**
*   `identify(identifyTime: UShort)`: Starts or stops the identification state for the device. A time of `0` stops it.
*   `identifyBatchable(identifyTime: UShort)`: Batchable version of `identify`.
*   `triggerEffect(effectIdentifier: IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum, effectVariant: IdentifyTrait.EffectVariantEnum)`: Starts a visual feedback effect (e.g., blinking an LED).
*   `triggerEffectBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `triggerEffect`.

### `interface MediaPlaybackTrait.StateChanged`
An interface representing a `StateChanged` event in media playback.
#### **Public Properties**
*   `audioAdvanceUnmuted: Boolean?`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum ---
# OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum
`enum OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum : Enum, ClusterEnum`
> The state of an OTA update.
### Enum Values
- `Applying` - The node is in the process of verifying and applying a software update.
- `DelayedOnApply` - The node is waiting due to an AwaitNextAction response.
- `DelayedOnQuery` - The node is waiting after a Busy response.
- `DelayedOnUserConsent` - The node is waiting on user consent.
- `Downloading` - The node is in the process of downloading a software update.
- `Idle` - The node is not yet in the process of software update.
- `Querying` - The node is in the process of querying an OTA provider.
- `RollingBack` - The node is recovering to a previous version.
- `Unknown` - The current state is unknown.
- `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
### Functions
- `valueOf(value: String)`: `OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum` - Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
- `values()`: `Array<OtaSoftwareUpdateRequestorTrait.UpdateStateEnum>` - Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type.
### Properties
- `traitId`: `open String`
- `typeName`: `open String`
- `value`: `open ULong`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.WindowCoveringTrait.SafetyStatus ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/WindowCoveringTrait.SafetyStatus ---
# WindowCoveringTrait.SafetyStatus
`data class WindowCoveringTrait.SafetyStatus`
> Reflects the state of the safety sensors and the common issues preventing movements.
### Constructors
- `SafetyStatus(remoteLockout: Boolean = false, tamperDetection: Boolean = false, failedCommunication: Boolean = false, positionFailure: Boolean = false, thermalProtection: Boolean = false, obstacleDetected: Boolean = false, power: Boolean = false, stopInput: Boolean = false, motorJammed: Boolean = false, hardwareFailure: Boolean = false, manualOperation: Boolean = false, protection: Boolean = false)` - Creates the SafetyStatus data class.
### Functions
- `toRaw()`: `open ULong` - Convert this ClusterBitmap to raw (bytes) format.
### Properties
- `bitmapName`: `String` - Name of the Matter bitmap, in UpperCamelCase.
- `failedCommunication`: `Boolean` - Communication failure to sensors or other safety equipment.
- `hardwareFailure`: `Boolean` - PCB, fuse and other electrics problems.
- `manualOperation`: `Boolean` - The actuator is manually operated and is preventing actuator movement.
- `motorJammed`: `Boolean` - Mechanical problem related to the motor(s) detected.
- `obstacleDetected`: `Boolean` - An obstacle is preventing actuator movement.
- `positionFailure`: `Boolean` - Device failed to reach the desired position.
- `power`: `Boolean` - Device has a power-related issue or limitation.
- `protection`: `Boolean` - Protection is activated.
- `remoteLockout`: `Boolean` - Movement commands are ignored outside some time-and-date range.
- `stopInput`: `Boolean` - Local safety sensor is preventing movements.
- `tamperDetection`: `Boolean` - Tampering detected on sensors or other safety equipment.
- `thermalProtection`: `Boolean` - Motor(s) and/or electric circuit thermal protection activated.
- `traitId`: `String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap Data Type.

# DescriptorTrait.Attributes
`interface DescriptorTrait.Attributes`

### Properties

- `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `partsList`: `List<UShort>?` - The composition of the device type instance, including the endpoints in this list. (Read-only)
- `serverList`: `List<UInt>?` - A list of cluster IDs for the server clusters present on the endpoint. (Read-only)
- `tagList`: `List<DescriptorTrait.SemanticTagStruct>?` - A list of tags used for disambiguating and providing information about endpoints. (Read-only)

- `isNullable`: `Boolean`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OnOffTrait.OnWithTimedOffCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OnOffTrait.OnWithTimedOffCommand.Request ---
# OnOffTrait.OnWithTimedOffCommand.Request
`class OnOffTrait.OnWithTimedOffCommand.Request`
> The request payload for the OnWithTimedOff command.
### Constructors
- `Request(onOffControl: OnOffTrait.OnOffControlBitmap = OnOffControlBitmap(), onTime: UShort, offWaitTime: UShort)` - Creates a request payload for the OnWithTimedOff command.
### Properties
- `offWaitTime`: `UShort` - The guarded off duration to set for the device. Sets the value of the `offWaitTime` attribute.
- `onOffControl`: `OnOffTrait.OnOffControlBitmap` - When set to `1`, the command will only be processed if the `onOff` attribute is `true`.
- `onTime`: `UShort` - The duration for which device is turned on. Sets the value of the `onTime` attribute.

### `enum ColorControlTrait.HueMoveMode`
> The direction in which to move a device's hue.
#### Enum Values
*   **`Down`**: Decrease the device's hue at a given rate.
*   **`Stop`**: Stops a command that is currently moving a device's hue.
*   **`UnknownValue`**: The enum value is out of range.
*   **`Up`**: Increase the device's hue at a given rate.
#### Properties
*   **`traitId`** `String`
*   **`typeName`** `String`
*   **`value`** `ULong`
#### Functions
*   **`valueOf(value: String)`**: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
*   **`values()`**: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface ThermostatTrait.Attributes`
> Attributes for the Thermostat cluster.
#### Properties
*   **`absMaxCoolSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Absolute maximum cooling setpoint limit (manufacturer-imposed).
*   **`absMaxHeatSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Absolute maximum heating setpoint limit (manufacturer-imposed).
*   **`absMinCoolSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Absolute minimum cooling setpoint limit (manufacturer-imposed).
*   **`absMinHeatSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Absolute minimum heating setpoint limit (manufacturer-imposed).
*   **`acCapacity`** `UShort?`: Capacity of the mini split AC.
*   **`acCapacityformat`** `ThermostatTrait.AcCapacityFormatEnum?`: Format for `acCapacity`.
*   **`acCoilTemperature`** `Short?`: Temperature of the AC coil.
*   **`acCompressorType`** `ThermostatTrait.AcCompressorTypeEnum?`: Type of compressor in the mini split AC.
*   **`acErrorCode`** `ThermostatTrait.AcErrorCodeBitmap?`: Bitmap indicating errors in the mini split AC.
*   **`acLouverPosition`** `ThermostatTrait.AcLouverPositionEnum?`: Position of the louver on the AC.
*   **`acRefrigerantType`** `ThermostatTrait.AcRefrigerantTypeEnum?`: Type of refrigerant in the mini split AC.
*   **`acType`** `ThermostatTrait.AcTypeEnum?`: Type of mini split AC.
*   **`acceptedCommandList`** `List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
*   **`activePresetHandle`** `ByteArray?`: The active preset.
*   **`activeScheduleHandle`** `ByteArray?`: The active schedule.
*   **`attributeList`** `List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
*   **`clusterRevision`** `UShort`: Revision of the server cluster specification.
*   **`controlSequenceOfOperation`** `ThermostatTrait.ControlSequenceOfOperationEnum?`: Possible system modes for the thermostat.
*   **`emergencyHeatDelta`** `UByte?`: Delta between `localTemperature` and setpoint to trigger emergency heat mode.
*   **`featureMap`** `ThermostatTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
*   **`generatedCommandList`** `List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
*   **`hvacSystemTypeConfiguration`** `ThermostatTrait.HvacSystemTypeBitmap?`: HVAC system type controlled by the thermostat.
*   **`localTemperature`** `Short?`: The current temperature.
*   **`localTemperatureCalibration`** `Byte?`: Offset applied to the measured temperature.
*   **`maxCoolSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Maximum user-defined cooling setpoint.
*   **`maxHeatSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Maximum user-defined heating setpoint.
*   **`minCoolSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Minimum user-defined cooling setpoint.
*   **`minHeatSetpointLimit`** `Short?`: Minimum user-defined heating setpoint.
*   **`minSetpointDeadBand`** `Byte?`: Minimum difference between heat and cool setpoints in auto mode.
*   **`numberOfDailyTransitions`** `UByte?`: Number of daily schedule transitions supported.
*   **`numberOfPresets`** `UByte?`: Number of presets supported.
*   **`numberOfScheduleTransitionPerDay`** `UByte?`: Number of schedule transitions per day supported.
*   **`numberOfScheduleTransitions`** `UByte?`: Number of schedule transitions supported.
*   **`numberOfSchedules`** `UByte?`: Number of schedules supported.
*   **`numberOfWeeklyTransitions`** `UByte?`: Number of weekly schedule transitions supported.
*   **`occupancy`** `ThermostatTrait.OccupancyBitmap?`: Specifies if the space is occupied.
*   **`occupiedCoolingSetpoint`** `Short?`: Cooling setpoint when the room is occupied.
*   **`occupiedHeatingSetpoint`** `Short?`: Heating setpoint when the room is occupied.
*   **`occupiedSetback`** `UByte?`: Temperature float allowed before initiating a state change (occupied).
*   **`occupiedSetbackMax`** `UByte?`: Maximum value for `occupiedSetback`.
*   **`occupiedSetbackMin`** `UByte?`: Minimum value for `occupiedSetback`.
*   **`outdoorTemperature`** `Short?`: The outdoor temperature.
*   **`piCoolingDemand`** `UByte?`: Cooling demand from the PI control loop in percent.
*   **`piHeatingDemand`** `UByte?`: Heating demand from the PI control loop in percent.
*   **`presetTypes`** `List<ThermostatTrait.PresetTypeStruct>?`: Available types of setpoint presets.
*   **`presets`** `List<ThermostatTrait.PresetStruct>?`: Setpoint presets.
*   **`remoteSensing`** `ThermostatTrait.RemoteSensingBitmap?`: Bitmap indicating use of remote sensors.
*   **`scheduleTypes`** `List<ThermostatTrait.ScheduleTypeStruct>?`: Available types of schedules.
*   **`schedules`** `List<ThermostatTrait.ScheduleStruct>?`: Schedules.
*   **`setpointChangeAmount`** `Short?`: Delta between current and previous active setpoint.
*   **`setpointChangeSource`** `ThermostatTrait.SetpointChangeSourceEnum?`: Source of the current active setpoint.
*   **`setpointChangeSourceTimestamp`** `UInt?`: UTC time of the last `setpointChangeSource` change.
*   **`setpointHoldExpiryTimestamp`** `UInt?`: UTC time when the setpoint hold expires.
*   **`startOfWeek`** `ThermostatTrait.StartOfWeekEnum?`: The day considered to be the start of the week.
*   **`systemMode`** `ThermostatTrait.SystemModeEnum?`: Current operating mode of the thermostat.
*   **`temperatureSetpointHold`** `ThermostatTrait.TemperatureSetpointHoldEnum?`: Temperature hold status.
*   **`temperatureSetpointHoldDuration`** `UShort?`: Period in minutes for which a setpoint hold is active.
*   **`thermostatProgrammingOperationMode`** `ThermostatTrait.ProgrammingOperationModeBitmap?`: Operational state of the thermostat's programming.
*   **`thermostatRunningMode`** `ThermostatTrait.ThermostatRunningModeEnum?`: Running mode of the thermostat (e.g., in auto mode).
*   **`thermostatRunningState`** `ThermostatTrait.RelayStateBitmap?`: Current relay state of heat, cool, and fan.
*   **`unoccupiedCoolingSetpoint`** `Short?`: Cooling setpoint when the room is unoccupied.
*   **`unoccupiedHeatingSetpoint`** `Short?`: Heating setpoint when the room is unoccupied.
*   **`unoccupiedSetback`** `UByte?`: Temperature float allowed before initiating a state change (unoccupied).
*   **`unoccupiedSetbackMax`** `UByte?`: Maximum value for `unoccupiedSetback`.
*   **`unoccupiedSetbackMin`** `UByte?`: Minimum value for `unoccupiedSetback`.

### `interface OccupancySensingTrait.Attributes`
> Attributes for the OccupancySensing cluster.
#### Properties
*   **`acceptedCommandList`** `List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
*   **`attributeList`** `List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
*   **`clusterRevision`** `UShort`: Revision of the server cluster specification.
*   **`featureMap`** `OccupancySensingTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
*   **`generatedCommandList`** `List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
*   **`holdTime`** `UShort?`
*   **`holdTimeLimits`** `OccupancySensingTrait.HoldTimeLimitsStruct?`
*   **`occupancy`** `OccupancySensingTrait.OccupancyBitmap?`: The sensed (processed) status of occupancy.
*   **`occupancySensorType`** `OccupancySensingTrait.OccupancySensorTypeEnum?`: The type of occupancy sensor.
*   **`occupancySensorTypeBitmap`** `OccupancySensingTrait.OccupancySensorTypeBitmap?`: The active occupancy sensor type.
*   **`physicalContactOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay`** `UShort?`: Time delay (seconds) before physical contact sensor switches to unoccupied.
*   **`physicalContactUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay`** `UShort?`: Time delay (seconds) before physical contact sensor switches to occupied.
*   **`physicalContactUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold`** `UByte?`: Number of events required to transition to occupied state for physical contact sensor.
*   **`pirOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay`** `UShort?`: Time delay (seconds) before PIR sensor changes to unoccupied.
*   **`pirUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay`** `UShort?`: Time delay (seconds) before PIR sensor changes to occupied.
*   **`pirUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold`** `UByte?`: Number of movement events required to transition to occupied state for PIR sensor.
*   **`ultrasonicOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay`** `UShort?`: Time delay (seconds) before ultrasonic sensor changes to unoccupied.
*   **`ultrasonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay`** `UShort?`: Time delay (seconds) before ultrasonic sensor changes to occupied.
*   **`ultrasonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold`** `UByte?`: Number of movement events required to transition to occupied state for ultrasonic sensor.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.MoveColorCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.MoveColorCommand.Request ---
### `class` ColorControlTrait.MoveColorCommand.Request
The request payload for the MoveColor command.
#### Constructor
*   `Request(rateX: Short = 0, rateY: Short = 0, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap(), optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap())`
#### Properties
*   `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
*   `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - If the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is 1, this bit overrides the corresponding bit in the `options` attribute.
*   `rateX: Short` - The rate of movement in steps per second for `currentX`.
*   `rateY: Short` - The rate of movement in steps per second for `currentY`.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.MoveColorCommand ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.MoveColorCommand ---
### `object` ColorControlTrait.MoveColorCommand
Move a device from its current color in a continuous fashion according to the rates specified. This command continues until the target color for the next step cannot be implemented. Setting both `rateX` and `rateY` to `0` stops any previously received `ColorControl` cluster command.
See also: `moveColor`.
#### Nested types
*   `class Request` - The request payload for the MoveColor command.
#### Properties
*   `commandId: String`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DoorLock ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DoorLock ---
### `interface` DoorLock
API for the DoorLock trait, providing an interface to secure a door. It inherits from `DoorLockTrait.Attributes`, `MatterTrait`, `Updatable`, and `DoorLockCommands`.
#### Nested types
*   `enum Attribute` - Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Command` - Descriptor for this trait's commands.
#### Functions
*   `supports(attribute: DoorLock.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: DoorLock.Command): Boolean`
*   `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
*   `update(optimisticReturn: (DoorLock) -> Unit, init: DoorLockTrait.MutableAttributes.() -> Unit): suspend DoorLock` - Creates a mutable copy to update, then saves and returns a new immutable copy.
#### Properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<DoorLock>`
#### Inherited Commands
*   `clearAliroReaderConfig(): suspend Unit`
*   `clearCredential(credential: DoorLockTrait.CredentialStruct?): suspend Unit` - Clear a single, a type of, or all credentials (except `ProgrammingPIN`).
*   `clearHolidaySchedule(holidayIndex: UByte): suspend Unit` - Clear a specific or all holiday schedules.
*   `clearUser(userIndex: UShort): suspend Unit` - Clear a specific user.
*   `clearWeekDaySchedule(weekDayIndex: UByte, userIndex: UShort): suspend Unit` - Clear a specific or all week day schedules for a user.
*   `clearYearDaySchedule(yearDayIndex: UByte, userIndex: UShort): suspend Unit` - Clear a specific or all year day schedules for a user.
*   `getCredentialStatus(credential: DoorLockTrait.CredentialStruct): suspend DoorLockTrait.GetCredentialStatusCommand.Response` - Retrieve the status of a credential.
*   `getHolidaySchedule(holidayIndex: UByte): suspend DoorLockTrait.GetHolidayScheduleCommand.Response` - Get a holiday schedule.
*   `getUser(userIndex: UShort): suspend DoorLockTrait.GetUserCommand.Response` - Retrieve the user type.
*   `getWeekDaySchedule(weekDayIndex: UByte, userIndex: UShort): suspend DoorLockTrait.GetWeekDayScheduleCommand.Response` - Retrieve a weekly schedule.
*   `getYearDaySchedule(yearDayIndex: UByte, userIndex: UShort): suspend DoorLockTrait.GetYearDayScheduleCommand.Response` - Retrieve a year day schedule.
*   `lockDoor(optionalArgs: ...): suspend Unit` - Lock the door.
*   `setAliroReaderConfig(signingKey: ByteArray, verificationKey: ByteArray, groupIdentifier: ByteArray, optionalArgs: ...): suspend Unit`
*   `setCredential(operationType: ..., credential: ..., credentialData: ByteArray, userIndex: UShort?, userStatus: ..., userType: ...): suspend DoorLockTrait.SetCredentialCommand.Response` - Set a credential.
*   `setHolidaySchedule(holidayIndex: UByte, localStartTime: UInt, localEndTime: UInt, operatingMode: ...): suspend Unit` - Set a holiday schedule.
*   `setUser(operationType: ..., userIndex: UShort, userName: String?, userUniqueId: UInt?, userStatus: ..., userType: ..., credentialRule: ...): suspend Unit` - Set a user on the lock.
*   `setWeekDaySchedule(weekDayIndex: UByte, userIndex: UShort, daysMask: ..., startHour: UByte, startMinute: UByte, endHour: UByte, endMinute: UByte): suspend Unit` - Set a weekly schedule.
*   `setYearDaySchedule(yearDayIndex: UByte, userIndex: UShort, localStartTime: UInt, localEndTime: UInt): suspend Unit` - Set a time-specific schedule.
*   `unboltDoor(optionalArgs: ...): suspend Unit` - Disengage the deadbolt.
*   `unlockDoor(optionalArgs: ...): suspend Unit` - Unlock the door.
*   `unlockWithTimeout(timeout: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): suspend Unit` - Unlock the door with a timeout.
#### Inherited Attributes
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - Supported client-generated commands.
*   `actuatorEnabled: Boolean?` - If the lock can process remote Lock/Unlock commands.
*   `aliroBleAdvertisingVersion: UByte?`
*   `aliroExpeditedTransactionSupportedProtocolVersions: List<ByteArray>?`
*   `aliroGroupResolvingKey: ByteArray?`
*   `aliroReaderGroupIdentifier: ByteArray?`
*   `aliroReaderGroupSubIdentifier: ByteArray?`
*   `aliroReaderVerificationKey: ByteArray?`
*   `aliroSupportedBleUwbProtocolVersions: List<ByteArray>?`
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - Supported attributes.
*   `autoRelockTime: UInt?` - Seconds to wait before auto-relocking.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - Supported cluster specification revision.
*   `credentialRulesSupport: DoorLockTrait.DlCredentialRuleMask?` - Supported credential rules.
*   `defaultConfigurationRegister: DoorLockTrait.DlDefaultConfigurationRegister?` - Default settings.
*   `doorClosedEvents: UInt?` - Number of door closed events.
*   `doorOpenEvents: UInt?` - Number of door opened events.
*   `doorState: DoorLockTrait.DoorStateEnum?` - Current door state.
*   `enableInsideStatusLed: Boolean?` - Enables/disables inside status LED.
*   `enableLocalProgramming: Boolean?` - Enables/disables local programming.
*   `enableOneTouchLocking: Boolean?` - Enables/disables one-touch locking.
*   `enablePrivacyModeButton: Boolean?` - Enables/disables inside privacy mode button.
*   `expiringUserTimeout: UShort?` - Minutes an `ExpiringUser` credential remains valid after first use.
*   `featureMap: DoorLockTrait.Feature` - Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - Supported server-generated commands.
*   `language: String?` - Language for the user interface.
*   `ledSettings: UByte?` - LED support modes.
*   `localProgrammingFeatures: DoorLockTrait.DlLocalProgrammingFeatures?` - Features disabled when `enableLocalProgramming` is false.
*   `lockState: DoorLockTrait.DlLockState?` - Current state of the lock.
*   `lockType: DoorLockTrait.DlLockType?` - Type of lock.
*   `maxPinCodeLength: UByte?` - Maximum PIN code length.
*   `maxRfidCodeLength: UByte?` - Maximum RFID code length.
*   `minPinCodeLength: UByte?` - Minimum PIN code length.
*   `minRfidCodeLength: UByte?` - Minimum RFID code length.
*   `numberOfAliroCredentialIssuerKeysSupported: UShort?`
*   `numberOfAliroEndpointKeysSupported: UShort?`
*   `numberOfCredentialsSupportedPerUser: UByte?` - Credentials assignable per user.
*   `numberOfHolidaySchedulesSupported: UByte?` - Supported holiday schedules.
*   `numberOfPinUsersSupported: UShort?` - Supported PIN users.
*   `numberOfRfidUsersSupported: UShort?` - Supported RFID users.
*   `numberOfTotalUsersSupported: UShort?` - Total users supported.
*   `numberOfWeekDaySchedulesSupportedPerUser: UByte?` - Configurable week day schedules per user.
*   `numberOfYearDaySchedulesSupportedPerUser: UByte?` - Configurable year day schedules per user.
*   `openPeriod: UShort?` - Minutes the door has been open since last closed-to-open transition.
*   `operatingMode: DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum?` - Current operating mode.
*   `requirePinforRemoteOperation: Boolean?` - If PIN is required for remote operations.
*   `sendPinOverTheAir: Boolean?` - If it's ok to send PINs over the air.
*   `soundVolume: UByte?` - Sound volume setting (0: Silent, 1: Low, 2: High, 3: Medium).
*   `supportedOperatingModes: DoorLockTrait.DlSupportedOperatingModes?` - Supported operating modes.
*   `userCodeTemporaryDisableTime: UByte?` - Seconds the lock shuts down after wrong code entry.
*   `wrongCodeEntryLimit: UByte?` - Incorrect credential attempts before lockout.
*   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface` EnergyEvseTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the EnergyEvse cluster.
#### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - Supported client-generated commands.
*   `approximateEvEfficiency: UShort?` - Vehicle efficiency in km/kWh * 1000. (Write)
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - Supported attributes.
*   `batteryCapacity: Long?` - EV battery capacity in mWh. (Read)
*   `chargingEnabledUntil: UInt?` - UTC time when charging automatically stops. Null means permanently enabled. (Read)
*   `circuitCapacity: Long?` - Capacity the EVSE circuit can provide. (Read)
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - Supported cluster specification revision.
*   `dischargingEnabledUntil: UInt?` - UTC time when discharging automatically stops. Null means permanently enabled. (Read)
*   `faultState: EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum?` - Type of fault detected by the EVSE. (Read)
*   `featureMap: EnergyEvseTrait.Feature` - Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - Supported server-generated commands.
*   `maximumChargeCurrent: Long?` - Maximum current (mA) the EVSE can deliver. (Read)
*   `maximumDischargeCurrent: Long?` - Maximum current (mA) the EVSE can receive. (Read)
*   `minimumChargeCurrent: Long?` - Minimum current (mA) the EVSE can deliver. (Read)
*   `nextChargeRequiredEnergy: Long?` - Energy (MWh) to add in the next charging target. (Read)
*   `nextChargeStartTime: UInt?` - UTC time for the next scheduled charge start. (Read)
*   `nextChargeTargetSoC: UByte?` - Target state of charge (%) for the next charge. (Read)
*   `nextChargeTargetTime: UInt?` - UTC time to complete the next scheduled charge. (Read)
*   `randomizationDelayWindow: UInt?` - Random window (seconds) to delay the start of a charging session. (Write)
*   `sessionDuration: UInt?` - Duration (seconds) of the current or most recent session. (Read)
*   `sessionEnergyCharged: Long?` - Energy (mWh) delivered during the current or most recent session. (Read)
*   `sessionEnergyDischarged: Long?` - Energy (mWh) received during the current or most recent session. (Read)
*   `sessionId: UInt?` - Unique identifier for the current or most recent session. (Read)
*   `state: EnergyEvseTrait.StateEnum?` - Current status of the EVSE. (Read)
*   `stateOfCharge: UByte?` - EV battery state of charge (0-100%). (Read)
*   `supplyState: EnergyEvseTrait.SupplyStateEnum?` - Indicates if the EV is allowed to charge or discharge. (Read)
*   `userMaximumChargeCurrent: Long?` - Maximum current (mA) set by the consumer. (Write)
*   `vehicleId: String?` - Vehicle ID read via ISO-15118. (Read)

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.PumpStatusBitmap ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.PumpStatusBitmap ---
### `data class` PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.PumpStatusBitmap
A bitmap indicating the current state of the pump.
#### Constructor
*   `PumpStatusBitmap(deviceFault: Boolean = false, supplyFault: Boolean = false, speedLow: Boolean = false, speedHigh: Boolean = false, localOverride: Boolean = false, running: Boolean = false, remotePressure: Boolean = false, remoteFlow: Boolean = false, remoteTemperature: Boolean = false)`
#### Properties
*   `deviceFault: Boolean` - A fault related to the system or pump device.
*   `supplyFault: Boolean` - A fault related to the supply to the pump.
*   `speedLow: Boolean` - Setpoint is too low to achieve.
*   `speedHigh: Boolean` - Setpoint is too high to achieve.
*   `localOverride: Boolean` - Control is overridden by hardware (e.g., STOP button, local HMI).
*   `running: Boolean` - Pump is currently running.
*   `remotePressure: Boolean` - A remote pressure sensor is used for regulation.
*   `remoteFlow: Boolean` - A remote flow sensor is used for regulation.
*   `remoteTemperature: Boolean` - A remote temperature sensor is used for regulation.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.RvcRunModeTrait.ModeTagStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/RvcRunModeTrait.ModeTagStruct ---
### `class` RvcRunModeTrait.ModeTagStruct
Describes a mode tag. The same manufacturer code and mode tag value in separate cluster instances are part of the same namespace and have the same meaning.
#### Constructor
*   `ModeTagStruct(mfgCode: OptionalValue<UShort> = OptionalValue.absent(), value: UShort)`
#### Properties
*   `mfgCode: OptionalValue<UShort>` - The manufacturer's vendor ID.
*   `value: UShort` - The mode tag. If `mfgCode` exists, this is a manufacturer-defined value; otherwise, it's a standard value.

*   `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - Time window (seconds) for `peakMeasuredValue`. (Read)

### `interface` OvenMode
API for the OvenMode trait, defining additional mode tags and enumerated values for oven devices. Inherits from `OvenModeTrait.Attributes`, `MatterTrait`, `Updatable`, and `OvenModeCommands`.

*   `enum Command` - Descriptor for this trait's commands.

*   `supports(command: OvenMode.Command): Boolean`

*   `update(optimisticReturn: (OvenMode) -> Unit, init: OvenModeTrait.MutableAttributes.() -> Unit): suspend OvenMode` - Creates a mutable copy to update, then saves and returns a new immutable copy.
*   `changeToMode(newMode: UByte): suspend OvenModeTrait.ChangeToModeCommand.Response` - Change device modes.
#### Properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<OvenMode>`
#### Inherited Attributes
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - Supported client-generated commands.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - Supported attributes.

*   `featureMap: OvenModeTrait.Feature` - Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - Supported server-generated commands.
*   `onMode: UByte?` - The `currentMode` value that depends on the state of an `OnOff` cluster on the same endpoint.

*   `supportedModes: List<OvenModeTrait.ModeOptionStruct>?` - The modes supported by the oven device.
*   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyPreferenceTrait.EnergyPriorityEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyPreferenceTrait.EnergyPriorityEnum ---
### enum `EnergyPreferenceTrait.EnergyPriorityEnum` : `ClusterEnum`
> Categories to prioritize for energy consumption.
#### Enum Values
*   `Comfort` - Emphasizes user comfort, such as the local temperature for a thermostat.
*   `Efficiency` - Emphasizes how much energy a device uses, such as electricity usage for a pump.
*   `Speed` - Emphasizes how quickly a device accomplishes its targeted use, such as the time it takes for a robot vacuum to complete its cleaning cycle.
*   `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
*   `WaterConsumption` - Emphasizes how much water is consumed during device usage, such as the amount of water a dishwasher uses during a cleaning cycle.
#### Public Properties
*   `traitId: open String`
*   `typeName: open String`
*   `value: open ULong`

### interface `FanControl` : `FanControlTrait.Attributes`, `MatterTrait`, `Updatable`, `FanControlCommands`
> API for the FanControl trait. This trait provides an interface for controlling the speed of a fan.
#### Nested Types
*   `enum FanControl.Attribute` - Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum FanControl.Command` - Descriptor enum for this trait's commands.
#### Public Functions
*   `supports(attribute: FanControl.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: FanControl.Command): Boolean`
#### Public Properties
*   `factory: open TraitFactory<FanControl>`
#### Inherited Functions
*   `step(direction: FanControlTrait.StepDirectionEnum, optionalArgs: ...): suspend Unit` - Speed up or slow down the fan, in steps.
*   `stepBatchable(direction: FanControlTrait.StepDirectionEnum, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>` - The batchable version of `step` command.
*   `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
*   `update(optimisticReturn: ..., init: ...): suspend FanControl` - Creates a mutable copy to update state.
#### Inherited Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported client-generated commands.
*   `airflowDirection: FanControlTrait.AirflowDirectionEnum?`
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported attribute IDs.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `fanMode: FanControlTrait.FanModeEnum?` - The current speed mode of the fan.
*   `fanModeSequence: FanControlTrait.FanModeSequenceEnum?` - The supported fan speed ranges.
*   `featureMap: FanControlTrait.Feature` - Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported server-generated commands.
*   `percentCurrent: UByte?` - The actual currently operating fan speed, or `0` if off.
*   `percentSetting: UByte?` - The speed setting for the fan.
*   `rockSetting: FanControlTrait.RockBitmap?` - Current active fan rocking motion settings.
*   `rockSupport: FanControlTrait.RockBitmap?` - Supported rocking motions.
*   `speedCurrent: UByte?` - The actual currently operating fan speed, or `0` if off.
*   `speedMax: UByte?` - The maximum fan speed.
*   `speedSetting: UByte?` - The speed setting for the fan.
*   `windSetting: FanControlTrait.WindBitmap?` - Current active fan wind feature settings.
*   `windSupport: FanControlTrait.WindBitmap?` - Supported wind modes.
*   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

### interface `CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes`
> Attributes for the CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement cluster.
#### Public Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported client-generated commands.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported attribute IDs.
*   `averageMeasuredValue: Float?` - The average value of `measuredValue` measured during the `averageMeasuredValueWindow`.
*   `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to measure the `averageMeasuredValue`.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `featureMap: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature` - Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported server-generated commands.
*   `levelValue: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.LevelValueEnum?` - The level of the substance detected.
*   `maxMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
*   `measuredValue: Float?` - The most recent measurement as a single-precision floating-point number.
*   `measurementMedium: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?` - The medium in which `measuredValue` is being measured.
*   `measurementUnit: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?` - The unit used by `measuredValue`.
*   `minMeasuredValue: Float?` - The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
*   `peakMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` measured during the `peakMeasuredValueWindow`.
*   `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to determine the `peakMeasuredValue`.
*   `uncertainty: Float?` - The range of error or deviation in `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValue`.

# ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.EnergyMeasurementStruct
`class ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.EnergyMeasurementStruct : ClusterStruct`
Indicates the amount of energy measured during a given measurement period.
### Constructor
`EnergyMeasurementStruct(energy: Long = 0, startTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt> = OptionalValue.absent(), endTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt> = OptionalValue.absent(), startSystime: OptionalValue<ULong> = OptionalValue.absent(), endSystime: OptionalValue<ULong> = OptionalValue.absent())`
*   Creates the EnergyMeasurementStruct class.
### Properties
*   `energy: Long` - The reported energy.
*   `startTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt>` - The timestamp in UTC of the start of the measurement period.
*   `endTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt>` - The timestamp in UTC of the end of the measurement period.
*   `startSystime: OptionalValue<ULong>` - The time, in milliseconds, since boot at the start of the measurement period.
*   `endSystime: OptionalValue<ULong>` - The time, in milliseconds, since boot at the end of the measurement period.
### Functions
*   `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor` - Returns the descriptor for the struct.
*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?` - Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.

# WindowCoveringTrait.EndProductType
`enum WindowCoveringTrait.EndProductType : Enum, ClusterEnum`
Specifies the subtype of window covering.
### Enum Values
*   `AwningTerracePatio` - A patio or terrace awning.
*   `AwningVerticalScreen` - A vertical screen.
*   `BalloonShade` - A balloon shade.
*   `CellularShade` - A cellular shade.
*   `CentralCurtain` - A central curtain.
*   `ExteriorVenetianBlind` - An exterior Venetian blind.
*   `ExteriorVerticalScreen` - An exterior vertical screen.
*   `InteriorBlind` - An interior blind.
*   `InteriorVenetianBlind` - An interior Venetian blind.
*   `LateralLeftCurtain` - A lateral left curtain.
*   `LateralRightCurtain` - A lateral right curtain.
*   `LayeredShade` - A layered shade.
*   `LayeredShade2D` - A two-dimensional layered shade.
*   `PleatedShade` - A pleated shade.
*   `RollerShade` - A roller shade.
*   `RollerShutter` - A roller shutter.
*   `RomanShade` - A roman shade.
*   `SheerShade` - A sheer shade.
*   `SlidingShutter` - A sliding shutter.
*   `SwingingShutter` - A swinging shutter.
*   `TiltOnlyInteriorBlind` - An interior blind that only tilts.
*   `TiltOnlyPergola` - A pergola that only tilts.
*   `Unknown` - An unknown window covering type.
*   `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
*   `VerticalBlindStripCurtain` - A vertical blind strip curtain.
*   `WovenWood` - A woven wood window covering.
### Functions
*   `valueOf(value: String): WindowCoveringTrait.EndProductType` - Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
*   `values(): Array<WindowCoveringTrait.EndProductType>` - Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type.
### Properties
*   `traitId: String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum Data Type.
*   `typeName: String` - Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
*   `value: ULong` - Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter Application Clusters spec.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.Identify ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/Identify ---
# Identify
`interface Identify : IdentifyTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait, Updatable, IdentifyCommands`
API for the Identify trait. This trait supports an endpoint identification state (such as a flashing light) that indicates to an observer which of several nodes or endpoints it is.
### Nested Types
*   `enum Identify.Attribute : Enum, Field` - Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Identify.Command : Enum` - Descriptor enum for this trait's commands.
### Properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<Identify>`
### Functions
*   `supports(attribute: Identify.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: Identify.Command): Boolean`
### Inherited Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `featureMap: UInt` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `identifyTime: UShort?` - The remaining length of time, in seconds, that the endpoint will continue to identify itself.
*   `identifyType: IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum?` - How the identification state is presented to the user.
*   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`
### Inherited Functions
*   `identify(identifyTime: UShort): suspend Unit` - Start or stop the identification state for the receiving device.
*   `identifyBatchable(identifyTime: UShort): BatchableCommand<Unit>` - The batchable version of `identify` command.
*   `triggerEffect(effectIdentifier: IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum, effectVariant: IdentifyTrait.EffectVariantEnum): suspend Unit` - Start an effect that provides visual feedback to the user.
*   `triggerEffectBatchable(effectIdentifier: IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum, effectVariant: IdentifyTrait.EffectVariantEnum): BatchableCommand<Unit>` - The batchable version of `triggerEffect` command.
*   `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
*   `update(optimisticReturn: (Identify) -> Unit, init: IdentifyTrait.MutableAttributes.() -> Unit): suspend Identify` - Creates a mutable copy of an object, mutates it, saves it, and returns a new immutable copy.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.EnhancedStepHueCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.EnhancedStepHueCommand.Request ---
# ColorControlTrait.EnhancedStepHueCommand.Request
`class ColorControlTrait.EnhancedStepHueCommand.Request`
The request payload for the EnhancedStepHue command.
### Constructor
`Request(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum = StepModeEnum.Up, stepSize: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap(), optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap())`
*   Creates a request payload for the EnhancedStepHue command.
### Properties
*   `stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum` - The direction in which to move the enhanced hue.
*   `stepSize: UShort` - The amount of units to move the device's `enhancedCurrentHue` to.
*   `transitionTime: UShort` - The time (in 0.1 seconds) taken to move the device to the new enhanced hue.
*   `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
*   `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - If the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is set to `1`, the bit set here overrides the corresponding bit in `options` attribute.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetScheduleStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetScheduleStruct ---
# EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetScheduleStruct
`class EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetScheduleStruct : ClusterStruct`
A set of user-specified charging targets for an electric vehicle for a set of specified days.
### Constructor
`ChargingTargetScheduleStruct(dayOfWeekForSequence: EnergyEvseTrait.TargetDayOfWeekBitmap = TargetDayOfWeekBitmap(), chargingTargets: List<EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetStruct> = emptyList())`
*   Creates the ChargingTargetScheduleStruct class.
### Properties
*   `dayOfWeekForSequence: EnergyEvseTrait.TargetDayOfWeekBitmap` - The days of the week to which the charging targets should be associated.
*   `chargingTargets: List<EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetStruct>` - A list of up to 10 charging targets for each of the associated days of the week.
### Functions
*   `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor` - Returns the descriptor for the struct.
*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?` - Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
# OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes
`interface OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the OzoneConcentrationMeasurement cluster.
### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
*   `averageMeasuredValue: Float?` - The average value of `measuredValue` measured during the `averageMeasuredValueWindow`. (Read-only)
*   `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to measure the `averageMeasuredValue`. (Read-only)
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `featureMap: OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands (server to client) which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `levelValue: OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.LevelValueEnum?` - The level of the substance detected. (Read-only)
*   `maxMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured. (Read-only)
*   `measuredValue: Float?` - The most recent measurement as a single-precision floating-point number. (Read-only)
*   `measurementMedium: OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?` - The medium in which `measuredValue` is being measured. (Read-only)
*   `measurementUnit: OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?` - The unit used by `measuredValue`. (Read-only)
*   `minMeasuredValue: Float?` - The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured. (Read-only)
*   `peakMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` that has been measured during the `peakMeasuredValueWindow`. (Read-only)
*   `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to determine the `peakMeasuredValue`. (Read-only)
*   `uncertainty: Float?` - The range of error or deviation that can be found in `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValue`. (Read-only)

Attributes for EnergyEvseTrait.

### Nested Types
*   `interface Attributes` - Attributes for the EnergyEvse cluster.
*   `class ChargingTargetScheduleStruct` - A set of user-specified charging targets for an electric vehicle.
*   `class ChargingTargetStruct` - A single user-specified charging target for an electric vehicle.
*   `object ClearTargetsCommand` - Allows a client to clear all stored charging targets.
*   `object DisableCommand` - Disables the EVSE from charging and discharging.
*   `object EnableChargingCommand` - Enables the EVSE to charge an electric vehicle.
*   `object EnableDischargingCommand` - Enables the EVSE to discharge an electric vehicle.
*   `interface EnergyTransferStarted` - Notification that the electric vehicle has started charging or discharging.
*   `interface EnergyTransferStopped` - Notification that the electric vehicle has stopped charging or discharging.
*   `enum EnergyTransferStoppedReasonEnum` - The reason for stopping the energy transfer.
*   `interface EvConnected` - Notification that the electric vehicle has connected to the EVSE.
*   `interface EvNotDetected` - Notification that the electric vehicle has been removed from the EVSE.

*   `object GetTargetsCommand` - Allows a client to retrieve the current set of charging targets.
*   `interface Rfid` - Notification that a radio frequency identification card (RFID) has been read.
*   `object SetTargetsCommand` - Allows a client to set user-specified charging targets.
*   `object StartDiagnosticsCommand` - Puts the EVSE into self-diagnostics mode.
*   `enum StateEnum` - The state of the electric vehicle.
*   `enum SupplyStateEnum` - Whether the electric vehicle is allowed to charge or disharge.
*   `data class TargetDayOfWeekBitmap` - The day of the week.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.ConstraintsStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.ConstraintsStruct ---
# DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.ConstraintsStruct
`class DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.ConstraintsStruct`
Allows a client such as an EMS to inform an ESA about a constraint period.
### Constructor
`ConstraintsStruct(startTime: UInt, duration: UInt, nominalPower: OptionalValue<Long> = OptionalValue.absent(), maximumEnergy: OptionalValue<Long> = OptionalValue.absent(), loadControl: OptionalValue<Byte> = OptionalValue.absent())`
*   Creates the ConstraintsStruct class.
### Properties
*   `startTime: UInt` - The start time, in UTC, of the constraint period.
*   `duration: UInt` - The duration, in seconds, of the constraint period.
*   `nominalPower: OptionalValue<Long>` - The nominal power, in milliwatts, at which the EMS requests the ESA to operate.
*   `maximumEnergy: OptionalValue<Long>` - The maximum amount of energy, in megawatt hours, that the ESA can use.
*   `loadControl: OptionalValue<Byte>` - Indicates the turn-up or turn-down value for the ESA, from -100 to +100.

# enum ActionsTrait.ActionErrorEnum

- `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature ---
# data class Pm10ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature
A bitmap representing the features of the Pm10ConcentrationMeasurement cluster.
### Constructor
`Feature(numericMeasurement: Boolean, levelIndication: Boolean, mediumLevel: Boolean, criticalLevel: Boolean, peakMeasurement: Boolean, averageMeasurement: Boolean)`
### Properties
- `averageMeasurement: Boolean`: Device supports average numeric measurement.
- `bitmapName: String`: Name of the Matter bitmap (e.g., "OnOffControlBitmap").
- `criticalLevel: Boolean`: Device supports the Critical concentration Level.
- `levelIndication: Boolean`: Device supports basic level indication using `LevelValueEnum`.
- `mediumLevel: Boolean`: Device supports the Medium concentration Level.
- `numericMeasurement: Boolean`: Device supports numeric measurement.
- `peakMeasurement: Boolean`: Device supports peak numeric measurement.
- `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
### Functions
- `toRaw(): ULong`: Converts the Feature bitmap to its raw `ULong` format.
