### Classes
- `AggregatorDevice`: A device that aggregates endpoints as a collection.
- `AirPurifierDevice`: A device that is designed to clean the air in a room.
- `AirQualitySensorDevice`: A device that monitors and measures air quality parameters.
- `BasicVideoPlayerDevice`: A device that can play media to a physical output or its own screen.
- `CastingVideoClientDevice`: A device that can launch content on a remote device.
- `CastingVideoPlayerDevice`: A device that can play media and launch content.
- `ColorDimmerSwitchDevice`: A device that controls a light's color temperature and intensity.
- `ColorTemperatureLightDevice`: A light that can be switched, dimmed, and have its color temperature adjusted.
- `ContactSensorDevice`: A device that detects if an object (e.g., door, window) is open or closed.
- `ContentAppDevice`: A device representing a content provider's application.
- `ControlBridgeDevice`: A controller for switching, dimming, and adjusting the color of a light.
- `CookSurfaceDevice`: A heating object on a cooking device.
- `CooktopDevice`: A cooking surface with one or more heating elements.
- `DimmableLightDevice`: A light that can be switched, dimmed, and controlled by an occupancy sensor.
- `DimmablePlugInUnitDevice`: A plug-in unit that can be switched and have its level adjusted.
- `DimmerSwitchDevice`: A device that can switch and control the intensity of a light.
- `DishwasherDevice`: A device that washes dishes and cutlery.
- `DoorLockControllerDevice`: A device capable of controlling a door lock.
- `DoorLockDevice`: A device used to secure a door.
- `ElectricalSensorDevice`: A device for electrical measurements.
- `EnergyEvseDevice`: A device that can charge an electric or plug-in hybrid vehicle.
- `ExtendedColorLightDevice`: A light that can be switched, dimmed, color temperature adjusted, and controlled by an occupancy sensor.
- `ExtractorHoodDevice`: A device installed above a stove to extract air.
- `FanDevice`: A device with a fan supporting multiple modes and variable speed.
- `FlowSensorDevice`: A device that measures and reports the flow rate of a fluid.
- `GenericSwitchDevice`: A switch that is either latching (rocker) or momentary (push button).
- `HeatingCoolingUnitDevice`: A device capable of heating or cooling a space.
- `HumiditySensorDevice`: A device that reports humidity measurements.
- `LightSensorDevice`: A device that measures and reports light intensity (illuminance).
- `MicrowaveOvenDevice`: A device that uses microwaves to heat food and beverages.
- `ModeSelectDevice`: A device that can be set to one of several predefined values.
- `OccupancySensorDevice`: A device that measures and reports occupancy state in an area.
- `OnOffLightDevice`: A light that can be switched on or off.
- `OnOffPluginUnitDevice`: A plug-in unit that can be switched on or off by a controller.
- `OnOffSensorDevice`: A sensor that can switch a bound lighting device on or off.
- `OvenDevice`: A device with one or more cabinets for heating food, optionally with a cooktop.
- `PowerSourceDevice`: A device that provides energy to operate or charge other equipment.
- `PressureSensorDevice`: A device that measures and reports the pressure of a fluid.
- `PumpControllerDevice`: A device that can configure and control a pump.
- `PumpDevice`: A device used to pump fluids, often with variable speed.
- `RainSensorDevice`: A device that reports the presence of rain.
- `RefrigeratorDevice`: A device with cabinets for chilling or freezing food.
- `RoboticVacuumCleanerDevice`: A device that autonomously vacuums floors.
- `RoomAirConditionerDevice`: A device for controlling air temperature in a single room.
- `RootNodeDevice`: A utility device type required for all nodes, describing the node and its endpoints.
- `SpeakerDevice`: An audio or video device with volume and mute controls.
- `TemperatureControlledCabinetDevice`: A single cabinet for chilling or freezing food.
- `TemperatureSensorDevice`: A device that reports temperature measurements.
- `ThermostatDevice`: A device for setting desired temperature, with optional sensors for temp, humidity, or occupancy.
- `VideoRemoteControlDevice`: A device that can control a video player.
- `WaterFreezeDetectorDevice`: A device that reports the potential of water freezing.
- `WaterLeakDetectorDevice`: A device that reports the presence of a water leak.
- `WaterValveDevice`: A device that can configure and control the flow of water.
- `WindowCoveringControllerDevice`: A device that can control an automatic window covering.
- `WindowCoveringDevice`: A window covering that can be raised or tilted.
### Enums
- `ActionsTrait.ActionErrorEnum`: Error types for actions.
- `ActionsTrait.ActionStateEnum`: State of an action.
- `ActionsTrait.ActionTypeEnum`: Types of actions.
- `DoorLockTrait.DlLockType`: Types of locks.
- `EnergyEvseTrait.EnergyTransferStoppedReasonEnum`: Reason for stopping energy transfer.
- `...` and many other enums defining states, types, modes, and statuses for various traits.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.EnableChargingCommand ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseTrait.EnableChargingCommand ---
# object EnergyEvseTrait.EnableChargingCommand
Enables the EVSE to charge an electric vehicle. Use this command via the `enableCharging` method on the `EnergyEvse` trait.
### Nested Types
- `class Request`: The request payload for the `EnableCharging` command.
### Properties
- `commandId: String`: Unique ID for the command.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.LevelControlCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LevelControlCommands ---
# interface LevelControlCommands
Provides commands for the LevelControl trait.
### Functions
#### move
`suspend fun move(moveMode: LevelControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UByte?, ...)`
- Changes a device's level based on a rate of movement.
- **Batchable**: `moveBatchable(...)`
#### moveToClosestFrequency
`suspend fun moveToClosestFrequency(frequency: UShort)`
- Changes a device's current frequency.
- **Batchable**: `moveToClosestFrequencyBatchable(...)`
#### moveToLevel
`suspend fun moveToLevel(level: UByte, transitionTime: UShort?, ...)`
- Moves a device from its current level to the provided level.
- **Batchable**: `moveToLevelBatchable(...)`
#### moveToLevelWithOnOff
`suspend fun moveToLevelWithOnOff(level: UByte, transitionTime: UShort?, ...)`
- Moves a device's level and toggles the `onOff` attribute based on the final level.
- **Batchable**: `moveToLevelWithOnOffBatchable(...)`
#### moveWithOnOff
`suspend fun moveWithOnOff(moveMode: LevelControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UByte?, ...)`
- Changes a device's level based on a rate and toggles the `onOff` attribute.
- **Batchable**: `moveWithOnOffBatchable(...)`
#### step
`suspend fun step(stepMode: LevelControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, ...)`
- Moves a device's level by a specific amount over a period of time.
- **Batchable**: `stepBatchable(...)`
#### stepWithOnOff
`suspend fun stepWithOnOff(stepMode: LevelControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, ...)`
- Steps a device's level and toggles the `onOff` attribute.
- **Batchable**: `stepWithOnOffBatchable(...)`
#### stop
`suspend fun stop(optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, ...)`
- Terminates any ongoing Move, MoveToLevel, or Step command.
- **Batchable**: `stopBatchable(...)`
#### stopWithOnOff
`suspend fun stopWithOnOff(optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, ...)`
- Identical to `stop`. Terminates any ongoing level change command.
- **Batchable**: `stopWithOnOffBatchable(...)`
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.MediaPlaybackTrait.PreviousCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/MediaPlaybackTrait.PreviousCommand.Request ---

### Constructor
`Request()`

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ActionsTrait.StopActionCommand.Request ---
# `ActionsTrait.StopActionCommand.Request`
A `class` representing the request payload for the StopAction command.
### Public Constructor
*   `Request(actionId: UShort, invokeId: OptionalValue<UInt> = OptionalValue.absent())`: Creates a request payload.
### Public Properties
*   `actionId: UShort`: The action identifier.

#### Functions

*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`: Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.
#### Properties
*   `height: Double`: The height, using the metric specified by the `metric` field.
*   `metric: ContentLauncherTrait.MetricTypeEnum`: The unit of measurement for dimensions. If `Percentage`, dimensions are a percentage of the display. For example, 50.0 on a 1920px wide display is 960px.

*   `ModeTagStruct(mfgCode: OptionalValue<UShort>, value: UShort)`

*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`: Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.
#### Properties

*   `value: UShort`: The mode tag. If `mfgCode` exists, this is a manufacturer-defined value; otherwise, it's a standard value.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetStruct ---
### `class EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetStruct : ClusterStruct`
A single user-specified charging target for an electric vehicle.
#### Constructor
*   `ChargingTargetStruct(targetTimeMinutesPastMidnight: UShort, targetSoC: OptionalValue<UByte>, addedEnergy: OptionalValue<Long>)`
#### Functions
*   `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor`: Returns the descriptor for the struct.
*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`: Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.
#### Properties
*   `addedEnergy: OptionalValue<Long>`: Energy (in mWh) to add before `targetTimeMinutesPastMidnight`.
*   `targetSoC: OptionalValue<UByte>`: Target state of charge (in %) to reach before `targetTimeMinutesPastMidnight`.
*   `targetTimeMinutesPastMidnight: UShort`: Desired completion time, in minutes past midnight (e.g., 6 a.m. is 360).
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.MicrowaveOvenControlTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/MicrowaveOvenControlTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface MicrowaveOvenControlTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the MicrowaveOvenControl cluster.
#### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported client-generated commands.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: Supported attribute IDs.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: Supported cluster specification revision.
*   `cookTime: UInt?`: Total cook time for the device operation. (Read-only)
*   `featureMap: MicrowaveOvenControlTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported server-generated commands.
*   `maxCookTime: UInt?`: Maximum settable `cookTime`. (Read-only)
*   `maxPower: UByte?`: Maximum settable power level. (Read-only)
*   `minPower: UByte?`: Minimum settable power level. (Read-only)
*   `powerSetting: UByte?`: Power level for the device operation. (Read-only)
*   `powerStep: UByte?`: Increment of power that can be set. (Read-only)
*   `selectedWattIndex: UByte?`: Index of `supportedWatts` for the current power setting. (Read-only)
*   `supportedWatts: List<UShort>?`: List of supported power levels in watts. (Read-only)
*   `wattRating: UShort?`: Power rating of the device in watts. (Read-only)

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.SystemModeEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.SystemModeEnum ---
# ThermostatTrait.SystemModeEnum
*enum*
> The current operating mode of the thermostat.
### Enum Values
*   `Auto` - Demand is generated for either cooling or heating, as required.
*   `Cool` - Demand is only generated for cooling.
*   `Dry` - Demand is only generated for dehumidification.
*   `EmergencyHeat` - Second stage heating is in use to achieve desired temperature.
*   `FanOnly` - Demand is only generated for fan.
*   `Heat` - Demand is only generated for heating.
*   `Off` - The thermostat is not set to engage any climate control functions.
*   `Precooling` - The thermostat is in precooling mode.
*   `Sleep` - The thermostat is set to sleep mode.
*   `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.TemperatureControlTrait.SetTemperatureCommand.Request ---

# TemperatureControlTrait.SetTemperatureCommand.Request
*class*
> The request payload for the SetTemperature command.
### Constructor
```kotlin
Request(
    targetTemperature: OptionalValue<Short> = OptionalValue.absent(),
    targetTemperatureLevel: OptionalValue<UByte> = OptionalValue.absent()
)
```
### Properties
*   `targetTemperature: OptionalValue<Short>` - The desired temperature setpoint.
*   `targetTemperatureLevel: OptionalValue<UByte>` - The desired temperature level, in terms of the index of the setting in the `supportedTemperatureLevels` list.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.StateEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseTrait.StateEnum ---
# EnergyEvseTrait.StateEnum
*enum*
> The state of the electric vehicle.
### Enum Values
*   `Fault` - The EVSE has detected a fault.
*   `NotPluggedIn` - The electric vehicle is not plugged in.
*   `PluggedInCharging` - The electric vehicle is plugged in, charging is in progress, and current is flowing.
*   `PluggedInDemand` - The electric vehicle is plugged in and is demanding current, but the EVSE is not allowing current to flow.
*   `PluggedInDischarging` - The electric vehicle is plugged in, discharging is in progress, and current is flowing.
*   `PluggedInNoDemand` - The electric vehicle is plugged in and is not demanding current.
*   `SessionEnding` - The electric vehicle is transitioning from any plugged-in state to `NotPluggedIn`.
*   `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.LevelControlTrait.MoveToLevelCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LevelControlTrait.MoveToLevelCommand.Request ---
# LevelControlTrait.MoveToLevelCommand.Request
*class*
> The request payload for the MoveToLevel command.
### Constructor
```kotlin
Request(
    level: UByte,
    transitionTime: UShort? = null,
    optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap(),
    optionsOverride: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap()
)
```
### Properties
*   `level: UByte` - The level to move the device to.
*   `optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
*   `optionsOverride: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - If the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is set to `1`, the bit set here overrides the corresponding bit in `options` attribute.
*   `transitionTime: UShort?` - The time (in 0.1 seconds) taken to move the device to the new level.

> Move to the next item in the media.

*   `Request` - The request payload for the Next command.
*   `Response` - The outcome of the `Next` command.
### Properties
*   `commandId: String` - Unique id corresponding to the command.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.TemperatureControlTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/TemperatureControlTrait.Attributes ---
# TemperatureControlTrait.Attributes
*interface*
> Attributes for the TemperatureControl cluster.
### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `featureMap: TemperatureControlTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `maxTemperature: Short?` - The maximum temperature at which the `temperatureSetpoint` attribute may be set.
*   `minTemperature: Short?` - The minimum temperature at which the `temperatureSetpoint` attribute may be set.
*   `selectedTemperatureLevel: UByte?` - The positional index of the setting in the `supportedTemperatureLevels` list, representing the currently selected temperature level.
*   `step: Short?` - The discrete value by which the `temperatureSetpoint` attribute can be changed.
*   `supportedTemperatureLevels: List<String>?` - The list of supported temperature level settings (e.g., "Cold", "Warm", "Hot").
*   `temperatureSetpoint: Short?` - The desired temperature setpoint.

    averageMeasurement: Boolean = false

### Properties

*   `bitmapName: String` - Name of the Matter bitmap.
*   `criticalLevel: Boolean` - Device supports the Critical concentration Level.
*   `levelIndication: Boolean` - Device supports basic level indication for substance using the `LevelValueEnum`.
*   `mediumLevel: Boolean` - Device supports the Medium concentration Level.
*   `numericMeasurement: Boolean` - Device supports numeric measurement of substance.
*   `peakMeasurement: Boolean` - Device supports peak numeric measurement of substance.

### `interface BasicInformationTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the BasicInformation cluster.
#### Properties

*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.

*   `dataModelRevision: UShort?`: Revision number of the data model. (Access: Read)
*   `featureMap: UInt`: Bitmap of supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
*   `hardwareVersion: UShort?`: Hardware version number of the node. (Access: Read)
*   `hardwareVersionString: String?`: Human-readable hardware version. (Access: Read)

*   `productId: UShort?`: Vendor-assigned Product ID. (Access: Read)
*   `productLabel: String?`: Vendor-specific human-readable product label. (Access: Read)
*   `productName: String?`: Human-readable model name for the node. (Access: Read)
*   `productUrl: String?`: Link to a product-specific web page. (Access: Read)
*   `reachable: Boolean?`: Indicates if the node can be reached. (Access: Read)
*   `serialNumber: String?`: Human-readable serial number. (Access: Read)
*   `softwareVersion: UInt?`: Current software version number on the node. (Access: Read)
*   `softwareVersionString: String?`: Human-readable software version. (Access: Read)
*   `specificationVersion: UInt?`: The specification version. (Access: Read)
*   `uniqueId: String?`: Manufacturer-specific unique identifier for the device. (Access: Read)
*   `vendorId: UShort?`: The Vendor ID. (Access: Read)
*   `vendorName: String?`: Human-readable vendor name. (Access: Read)

### `enum DoorLockTrait.OperationErrorEnum`
Indicates the cause of a Lock or Unlock operation failure.
#### Enum Values
*   `DisabledUserDenied`: Error due to a disabled user ID or credential.
*   `InsufficientBattery`: Error due to insufficient battery power.
*   `InvalidCredential`: Error due to an invalid credential.
*   `Restricted`: Error due to a schedule restriction.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
*   `Unspecified`: Error due to an unknown or unspecified source.
#### Public Functions
*   `valueOf(value: String)`: Returns the enum constant with the specified name.
*   `values()`: Returns an array of all enum constants.
#### Public Properties
*   `traitId: open String`: Trait identifier of the defining Matter Cluster.
*   `typeName: open String`: Name of the Matter Data Type.
*   `value: open ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LevelControlTrait.StepCommand.Request ---
### `class LevelControlTrait.StepCommand.Request`
Request payload for the `Step` command.
#### Constructor
*   `Request(stepMode: LevelControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, transitionTime: UShort?, optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`
#### Properties
*   `optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in the `options` attribute to override.
*   `optionsOverride: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in the `options` attribute based on `optionsMask`.
*   `stepMode: LevelControlTrait.StepModeEnum`: The direction to move the level (Up or Down).
*   `stepSize: UByte`: The number of units to move the `currentLevel`.
*   `transitionTime: UShort?`: Time (in 0.1s) to move to the new level.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ElectricalPowerMeasurementTrait.MeasurementRangeStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ElectricalPowerMeasurementTrait.MeasurementRangeStruct ---
# ElectricalPowerMeasurementTrait.MeasurementRangeStruct
`class ElectricalPowerMeasurementTrait.MeasurementRangeStruct : ClusterStruct`
The maximum and minimum values of a given measurement type during a measurement period, along with the observation times of these values.
### Properties
*   `measurementType: ElectricalPowerMeasurementTrait.MeasurementTypeEnum`: The measurement type for the range provided.
*   `min: Long`: The smallest measured value for the associated measurement over the period.
*   `max: Long`: The largest measured value for the associated measurement over the period.
*   `startTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt>`: The timestamp in UTC of the start of the measurement period.
*   `endTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt>`: The timestamp in UTC of the end of the measurement period.
*   `minTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt>`: The most recent timestamp in UTC of the value in the `min` field.
*   `maxTimestamp: OptionalValue<UInt>`: The most recent timestamp in UTC of the value in the `max` field.
*   `startSystime: OptionalValue<ULong>`: The time since boot at the start of the measurement period.
*   `endSystime: OptionalValue<ULong>`: The time, in milliseconds, since boot at the end of the measurement period.
*   `minSystime: OptionalValue<ULong>`: The measurement time, in milliseconds, since boot of the value in the `min` field.
*   `maxSystime: OptionalValue<ULong>`: The measurement time, in milliseconds, since boot of the value in the `max` field.
### Functions
*   `getDescriptor(): StructDescriptor`: Returns the descriptor for the struct.
*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`: Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the RadonConcentrationMeasurement cluster.
#### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
*   `averageMeasuredValue: Float?`: The average value of `measuredValue` measured during the `averageMeasuredValueWindow`.
*   `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: The window of time, in seconds, used to measure the `averageMeasuredValue`.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `featureMap: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature`: Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `levelValue: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.LevelValueEnum?`: The level of the substance detected.
*   `maxMeasuredValue: Float?`: The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
*   `measuredValue: Float?`: The most recent measurement as a single-precision floating-point number, in units specified by `measurementUnit`.
*   `measurementMedium: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?`: The medium in which `measuredValue` is being measured.
*   `measurementUnit: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?`: The unit used by `measuredValue`.
*   `minMeasuredValue: Float?`: The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
*   `peakMeasuredValue: Float?`: The maximum value of `measuredValue` measured during the `peakMeasuredValueWindow`.
*   `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: The window of time, in seconds, used to determine the `peakMeasuredValue`.
*   `uncertainty: Float?`: The range of error or deviation that can be found in `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValue`.

### `interface TargetNavigatorTrait.Attributes`

#### Public properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.

*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The server cluster specification revision.

*   `featureMap: UInt`: Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
*   `targetList: List<TargetNavigatorTrait.TargetInfoStruct>?`: A list of unique navigable targets within the UX of an endpoint.

*   `Up`: The condition is indicated by an increasing value.

### `class LevelControlTrait.StepWithOnOffCommand.Request`

- `Request(stepMode: StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, transitionTime: UShort?, optionsMask: OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: OptionsBitmap)`
#### Properties

- `stepSize: UByte`: The amount to move the device's `currentLevel`.

- `optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in `options` to override.
- `optionsOverride: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in the `options` attribute.

- `carbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to CO2 measurement.
- `carbonMonoxideConcentrationMeasurement: CarbonMonoxideConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to CO measurement.
- `formaldehydeConcentrationMeasurement: FormaldehydeConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to formaldehyde measurement.
- `identify: Identify?`: Supports endpoint identification (e.g., flashing light).
- `nitrogenDioxideConcentrationMeasurement: NitrogenDioxideConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to NO2 measurement.
- `ozoneConcentrationMeasurement: OzoneConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to ozone measurement.
- `pm1ConcentrationMeasurement: Pm1ConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to PM1 measurement.
- `pm10ConcentrationMeasurement: Pm10ConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to PM10 measurement.
- `pm25ConcentrationMeasurement: Pm25ConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to PM2.5 measurement.
- `radonConcentrationMeasurement: RadonConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to radon measurement.
- `relativeHumidityMeasurement: RelativeHumidityMeasurement?`: Interface to relative humidity measurement.
- `temperatureMeasurement: TemperatureMeasurement?`: Interface to temperature measurement.
- `totalVolatileOrganicCompoundsConcentrationMeasurement: TotalVolatileOrganicCompoundsConcentrationMeasurement?`: Interface to TVOC measurement.

### `enum DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.EsaStateEnum`
_The state of the Energy Service Appliance (ESA)._

- `Online`: ESA is working normally.
- `Offline`: ESA is not available.
- `Paused`: ESA is paused by a client `PauseRequest` command.
- `PowerAdjustActive`: ESA is actively adjusting its power consumption.
- `Fault`: ESA is in a fault state.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum ---
# DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum
`enum DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum`
Operating modes for a door lock.
### Enum Values
- `NoRemoteLockUnlock` - Disables remote interaction with the lock (Lock, Unlock, Toggle, Unlock with Timeout commands).
- `Normal` - The lock operates normally.
- `Passage` - The lock is open or can be operated without user validation.
- `Privacy` - Only possible if the door is locked. All external interaction is disabled. Manual unlocking changes the mode to Normal.
- `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
- `Vacation` - Only remote interaction is enabled.
### Public Functions
- `valueOf(value: String): DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum` - Returns the enum constant with the specified name.
- `values(): Array<DoorLockTrait.OperatingModeEnum>` - Returns an array of all enum constants.
### Public Properties
- `traitId: String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
- `typeName: String` - Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
- `value: ULong` - Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter spec.

API for the RadonConcentrationMeasurement trait, providing an interface to radon concentration measurement functionality.

### Public Functions

### Public Properties
- `factory: TraitFactory<RadonConcentrationMeasurement>`
### Inherited Functions
- `forceRead(): suspend Unit` - From `com.google.home.TraitStateInvalidation`.
### Inherited Properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
- `averageMeasuredValue: Float?` - The average value of `measuredValue` measured during the `averageMeasuredValueWindow`.
- `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to measure the `averageMeasuredValue`.

- `featureMap: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature` - Indicates support for optional cluster features.

- `maxMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
- `measuredValue: Float?` - The most recent measurement as a single-precision floating-point number.
- `measurementMedium: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?` - The medium in which `measuredValue` is being measured.
- `measurementUnit: RadonConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?` - The unit used by `measuredValue`.
- `minMeasuredValue: Float?` - The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
- `peakMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` measured during the `peakMeasuredValueWindow`.
- `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to determine the `peakMeasuredValue`.
- `uncertainty: Float?` - The range of error or deviation in `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValue`.

The amount and duration of a power adjustment.

### Public Properties

- `maxPower: Long` - The maximum power, in milliwatts, for the adjustment. A negative value indicates power flow away from loads.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.SwitchTrait.Feature ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/SwitchTrait.Feature ---
# `data class SwitchTrait.Feature`
Represents the Switch cluster FeatureMap.
### Constructor
- **`Feature(latchingSwitch: Boolean, momentarySwitch: Boolean, momentarySwitchRelease: Boolean, momentarySwitchLongPress: Boolean, momentarySwitchMultiPress: Boolean, actionSwitch: Boolean)`**
### Properties
- **`actionSwitch: Boolean`**
- **`bitmapName: String`**: Name of the Matter bitmap (e.g., "OnOffControlBitmap").
- **`latchingSwitch: Boolean`**: The switch maintains its position after being used.
- **`momentarySwitch: Boolean`**: The switch does not maintain its position after being used.
- **`momentarySwitchLongPress: Boolean`**: The switch can distinguish between long and short presses.
- **`momentarySwitchMultiPress: Boolean`**: The switch can report double or multiple presses.
- **`momentarySwitchRelease: Boolean`**: The switch can report release events.
- **`traitId: String`**: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap.
### Functions
- **`toRaw(): ULong`**: Converts this ClusterBitmap to its raw byte format.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.AccountLogin ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/AccountLogin ---
# `interface AccountLogin`
*Implements `AccountLoginTrait.Attributes`, `MatterTrait`, `AccountLoginCommands`*
API for the AccountLogin trait, which facilitates user account login on a content app or node.
### Nested Types
- **`enum Attribute`**: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
- **`enum Command`**: Descriptor for this trait's commands.
### Functions
- **`supports(attribute: AccountLogin.Attribute): Boolean`**
- **`supports(command: AccountLogin.Command): Boolean`**
### Properties
- **`factory: TraitFactory<AccountLogin>`**
### Inherited Functions
- From `AccountLoginCommands`:
    - **`getSetupPin(tempAccountIdentifier: String): suspend AccountLoginTrait.GetSetupPinCommand.Response`**: Gets a setup PIN if the content app and commissionee user accounts match.
    - **`getSetupPinBatchable(...)`**: Batchable version of `getSetupPin`.
    - **`login(tempAccountIdentifier: String, setupPin: String, ...): suspend Unit`**: Allows the content app to assume the user account of the commissionee.
    - **`loginBatchable(...)`**: Batchable version of `login`.
    - **`logout(...): suspend Unit`**: Instructs the content app to clear the current user account.
    - **`logoutBatchable(...)`**: Batchable version of `logout`.
- From `TraitStateInvalidation`:
    - **`forceRead(): suspend Unit`**
### Inherited Properties
- From `AccountLoginTrait.Attributes`:
    - **`acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`**: Supported client-generated commands.
    - **`attributeList: List<UInt>`**: Supported attribute IDs.
    - **`clusterRevision: UShort`**: Supported cluster specification revision.
    - **`featureMap: UInt`**: Supported optional cluster features.
    - **`generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`**: Supported server-generated commands.
- From `Trait`:
    - **`metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`**

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.Attributes ---
# `interface ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the ValveConfigurationAndControl cluster.
### Properties
- **`acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`**: List of supported client-generated commands.
- **`attributeList: List<UInt>`**: List of supported attribute IDs.
- **`autoCloseTime: ULong?`**: (Read-only) The UTC time when the valve will close.
- **`clusterRevision: UShort`**: The revision of the server cluster specification.
- **`currentLevel: UByte?`**: (Read-only) The current valve level as a percentage.
- **`currentState: ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveStateEnum?`**: (Read-only) The current state of the valve.
- **`defaultOpenDuration: UInt?`**: (Write-only) The default duration in seconds the valve remains open.
- **`defaultOpenLevel: UByte?`**: (Write-only) The default target level when the valve opens.
- **`featureMap: ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.Feature`**: Supported optional cluster features.
- **`generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`**: List of supported server-generated commands.
- **`levelStep: UByte?`**: (Read-only) The step size supported by the valve.
- **`openDuration: UInt?`**: (Read-only) The total duration in seconds for the current opening.
- **`remainingDuration: UInt?`**: (Read-only) The remaining duration in seconds until the valve closes.
- **`targetLevel: UByte?`**: (Read-only) The target level of the valve as a percentage.
- **`targetState: ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveStateEnum?`**: (Read-only) The target state of the valve while changing state.
- **`valveFault: ValveConfigurationAndControlTrait.ValveFaultBitmap?`**: (Read-only) Any faults registered by the valve.

### Inherited Functions
- From `HasEvents`:
    - **`events()`**: Gets a flow of all available events.
    - **`events(event: EventFactory<T>)`**: Gets a flow of a specific event.
    - **`events(trait: TraitFactory<T>)`**: Gets a flow of all events from a specific trait.
- From `TraitProvider`:
    - **`metadata(traitFactory: TraitFactory<T>)`**: Accesses a specific trait's metadata.
    - **`trait(traitFactory: TraitFactory<T>)`**: Accesses a specific trait.
    - **`traits()`**: Returns the set of available traits.

Configuration and status information for a WindowCovering.
### Constructor
- **`ConfigStatus(operational: Boolean, onlineReserved: Boolean, liftMovementReversed: Boolean, liftPositionAware: Boolean, tiltPositionAware: Boolean, liftEncoderControlled: Boolean, tiltEncoderControlled: Boolean)`**
### Properties
- **`bitmapName: String`**: Name of the Matter bitmap.
- **`liftEncoderControlled: Boolean`**: `true` if the covering uses an encoder for height.
- **`liftMovementReversed: Boolean`**: `true` if lift movement is reversed.
- **`liftPositionAware: Boolean`**: `true` if the lift control is position-aware.
- **`onlineReserved: Boolean`**: Deprecated.
- **`operational: Boolean`**: `true` if the covering is operational.
- **`tiltEncoderControlled: Boolean`**: `true` if the covering uses an encoder for tilt angle.
- **`tiltPositionAware: Boolean`**: `true` if the tilt control is position-aware.
- **`traitId: String`**: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap.
### Functions
- **`toRaw(): ULong`**: Converts this ClusterBitmap to its raw byte format.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.Attributes ---
# interface DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the DeviceEnergyManagement cluster.
### Properties
- `absMaxPower: Long?` - The maximum electrical power, in milliwatts, that the ESA can consume when it's on. Must be >= `AbsMinPower`. For a generator ESA, this is a positive number representing max discharge power. (Access type: Read)
- `absMinPower: Long?` - The minimum electrical power, in milliwatts, that the ESA can consume when it's on (excluding power save/standby). For a generator ESA, this is a negative number representing max charge power. (Access type: Read)
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported client-generated commands.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported attribute IDs.
- `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification.
- `esaCanGenerate: Boolean?` - Indicates if the ESA is a generator (`true`) or a load (`false`). (Access type: Read)
- `esaState: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.EsaStateEnum?` - The current state of the ESA. If `Offline` or `Fault`, it cannot be controlled by an EMS. (Access type: Read)
- `esaType: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.EsaTypeEnum?` - The type of the ESA, for determining energy consumption/generation/storage behavior. (Access type: Read)
- `featureMap: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.Feature` - A bitmap of supported optional cluster features.
- `forecast: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.ForecastStruct?` - The ESA's intended forecast. Null if no forecast is available. (Access type: Read)
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported server-generated commands.
- `optOutState: DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.OptOutStateEnum?` - Indicates if the ESA has opted out of energy management. If `true`, it won't be controlled by an EMS. (Access type: Read)
- `powerAdjustmentCapability: List<DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.PowerAdjustStruct>?` - Indicates how the ESA can be adjusted at the current time. An empty list indicates no power adjustment is currently available. (Access type: Read)

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.LevelControl ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LevelControl ---
# interface LevelControl : LevelControlTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait, Updatable, LevelControlCommands
API for the LevelControl trait. This trait provides an interface for controlling a characteristic of a device that can be set to a level.
### Nested Types
- `enum Attribute`: Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
- `enum Command`: Descriptor enum for this trait's commands.
### Functions
- `supports(attribute: LevelControl.Attribute): Boolean`
- `supports(command: LevelControl.Command): Boolean`
### Properties
- `factory: open TraitFactory<LevelControl>`
### Inherited Functions
- From `LevelControlCommands`:
    - `move(...)`: Change a device's level based on a rate of movement.
    - `moveBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `move`.
    - `moveToClosestFrequency(frequency: UShort)`: Change a device's current frequency.
    - `moveToClosestFrequencyBatchable(frequency: UShort)`: Batchable version of `moveToClosestFrequency`.
    - `moveToLevel(...)`: Move a device from its current level to the provided level.
    - `moveToLevelBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `moveToLevel`.
    - `moveToLevelWithOnOff(...)`: Move to a level and toggle `onOff`.
    - `moveToLevelWithOnOffBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `moveToLevelWithOnOff`.
    - `moveWithOnOff(...)`: Move level based on rate and toggle `onOff`.
    - `moveWithOnOffBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `moveWithOnOff`.
    - `step(...)`: Move a device's level a specific amount over a period of time.
    - `stepBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `step`.
    - `stepWithOnOff(...)`: Step level and toggle `onOff`.
    - `stepWithOnOffBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `stepWithOnOff`.
    - `stop(...)`: Terminate a Move, MoveToLevel, or Step command.
    - `stopBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `stop`.
    - `stopWithOnOff(...)`: Terminate a Move, MoveToLevel, or Step command.
    - `stopWithOnOffBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `stopWithOnOff`.
- From `com.google.home.TraitStateInvalidation`: `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
- From `com.google.home.Updatable`: `update(...)` - Creates a mutable copy, mutates it, and returns an updated immutable copy.
### Inherited Properties
- From `LevelControlTrait.Attributes`:
    - `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - List of supported client-generated commands.
    - `attributeList: List<UInt>` - List of supported attribute IDs.
    - `clusterRevision: UShort` - The server cluster specification revision.
    - `currentFrequency: UShort?` - The frequency at which the device is at `currentLevel`.
    - `currentLevel: UByte?` - The current level of the device.
    - `defaultMoveRate: UByte?` - The movement rate (units/sec) for `move` commands with a null `rate`.
    - `featureMap: LevelControlTrait.Feature` - Bitmap of supported optional cluster features.
    - `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - List of supported server-generated commands.
    - `maxFrequency: UShort?` - Max value for `currentFrequency`.
    - `maxLevel: UByte?` - Max value for `currentLevel`.
    - `minFrequency: UShort?` - Min value for `currentFrequency`.
    - `minLevel: UByte?` - Min value for `currentLevel`.
    - `offTransitionTime: UShort?` - Time (in 0.1s) to move from `maxLevel` to `minLevel` on an `off` command.
    - `onLevel: UByte?` - The `currentLevel` value when `onOff` is set to true.
    - `onOffTransitionTime: UShort?` - Time (in 0.1s) for level transition on `on`/`off` commands.
    - `onTransitionTime: UShort?` - Time (in 0.1s) to move from `minLevel` to `maxLevel` on an `on` command.
    - `options: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap?` - Bitmap for default command behavior.
    - `remainingTime: UShort?` - Time remaining (in 0.1s) until the current command is complete.
    - `startUpCurrentLevel: UByte?` - Desired startup level when power is supplied.
- From `com.google.home.Trait`: `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

# enum ElectricalPowerMeasurementTrait.MeasurementTypeEnum : ClusterEnum
The type of measurement.
### Enum Values
- `ActiveCurrent` - Active current in milliamps (mA).
- `ActivePower` - Active power in milliwatts (mW).
- `ApparentCurrent` - Apparent current in milliamps (mA).
- `ApparentPower` - Apparent power in millivolt-amps (mVA).
- `ElectricalEnergy` - Electrical energy in milliwatt-hours (mWh).
- `Frequency` - AC frequency in millihertz (mHz).
- `NeutralCurrent` - AC neutral current in milliamps (mA).
- `PowerFactor` - Power factor ratio in +/- 1/100ths of a percent.
- `RMSCurrent` - RMS current in milliamps (mA).
- `RMSPower` - RMS power in milliwatts (mW).
- `RMSVoltage` - RMS voltage in millivolts (mV).
- `ReactiveCurrent` - Reactive current in milliamps (mA).
- `ReactivePower` - Reactive power in millivolt-amps reactive (mVAR).
- `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
- `Unspecified` - Unspecified.
- `Voltage` - Voltage in millivolts (mV).

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.StepSaturationCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.StepSaturationCommand.Request ---
# class ColorControlTrait.StepSaturationCommand.Request
The request payload for the StepSaturation command.
### Constructor
- `Request(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, transitionTime: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`
### Properties
- `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
- `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - If the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is set, this overrides the corresponding bit in the `options` attribute.
- `stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum` - The direction in which to move the saturation.
- `stepSize: UByte` - The amount of units to move the device's `currentSaturation` to.
- `transitionTime: UByte` - The time (in 0.1 seconds) taken to move the device to the new saturation.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes ---
# interface Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the Pm1ConcentrationMeasurement cluster.
### Properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported client-generated commands.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported attribute IDs.
- `averageMeasuredValue: Float?` - The average value of `measuredValue` measured during the `averageMeasuredValueWindow`. (Access type: Read)
- `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time, in seconds, used to determine the `averageMeasuredValue`. (Access type: Read)
- `clusterRevision: UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification.
- `featureMap: Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature` - A bitmap of supported optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of supported server-generated commands.
- `levelValue: Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.LevelValueEnum?` - The level of the substance detected. (Access type: Read)
- `maxMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured. (Access type: Read)
- `measuredValue: Float?` - The most recent measurement as a single-precision floating-point number, in units specified by `measurementUnit`. (Access type: Read)
- `measurementMedium: Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?` - The medium in which `measuredValue` is being measured. (Access type: Read)
- `measurementUnit: Pm1ConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?` - The unit used by `measuredValue`. (Access type: Read)
- `minMeasuredValue: Float?` - The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured. (Access type: Read)
- `peakMeasuredValue: Float?` - The maximum value of `measuredValue` that has been measured during the `peakMeasuredValueWindow`. (Access type: Read)
- `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?` - The window of time used for determining the `peakMeasuredValue` in seconds. (Access type: Read)
- `uncertainty: Float?` - The range of error or deviation that can be found in `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValueWindow`. (Access type: Read)
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.LowPowerCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LowPowerCommands ---
# interface LowPowerCommands
API for the `LowPower` trait.
**Known Subclasses:** `LowPower`
## Functions
*   `suspend fun sleep(): Unit`
*   `fun sleepBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Puts the device into low power mode. `sleepBatchable` is the batchable version.

# data class OzoneConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature
OzoneConcentrationMeasurement cluster FeatureMap.
## Constructor
```kotlin
Feature(
    numericMeasurement: Boolean = false,
    levelIndication: Boolean = false,
    mediumLevel: Boolean = false,
    criticalLevel: Boolean = false,
    peakMeasurement: Boolean = false,
    averageMeasurement: Boolean = false
)
```
## Functions
*   `fun toRaw(): ULong`: Converts this ClusterBitmap to raw (bytes) format.
## Properties
*   `averageMeasurement: Boolean`: Device supports the average numeric measurement of substance.
*   `bitmapName: String`: Name of the Matter bitmap, in UpperCamelCase (e.g., "OnOffControlBitmap").
*   `criticalLevel: Boolean`: Device supports the Critical concentration Level.
*   `levelIndication: Boolean`: Device supports basic level indication for substance using `LevelValueEnum`.
*   `mediumLevel: Boolean`: Device supports the Medium concentration Level.
*   `numericMeasurement: Boolean`: Device supports numeric measurement of substance.
*   `peakMeasurement: Boolean`: Device supports peak numeric measurement of substance.
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap Data Type.

# interface ActionsCommands
API for the Actions trait.
**Known Subclasses:** `Actions`
## Functions
*   `suspend fun disableAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun disableActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Disables an action.
*   `suspend fun disableActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun disableActionWithDurationBatchable(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Disables an action for a specified duration, then re-enables it.
*   `suspend fun enableAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun enableActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Enables an action.
*   `suspend fun enableActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun enableActionWithDurationBatchable(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Enables an action for a specified duration, then disables it.
*   `suspend fun instantAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun instantActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Triggers an action (state change) asynchronously.
*   `suspend fun instantActionWithTransition(actionId: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun instantActionWithTransitionBatchable(actionId: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Triggers an action with a specified transition time.
*   `suspend fun pauseAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun pauseActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Pauses an ongoing action.
*   `suspend fun pauseActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun pauseActionWithDurationBatchable(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Pauses an ongoing action for a specified duration, then resumes it.
*   `suspend fun resumeAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun resumeActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Resumes a paused action.
*   `suspend fun startAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun startActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Starts an action.
*   `suspend fun startActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun startActionWithDurationBatchable(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Starts an action for a specified duration, then stops it.
*   `suspend fun stopAction(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...)`
*   `fun stopActionBatchable(actionId: UShort, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   Stops an ongoing action.

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetMode ---
# interface RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetMode
API for the RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetMode trait.
## Nested Types
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Command`: Descriptor for this trait's commands.
## Functions
*   `fun supports(attribute: Attribute): Boolean`
*   `fun supports(command: Command): Boolean`
*   `suspend fun changeToMode(newMode: UByte): Response`: Changes device modes.
*   `fun changeToModeBatchable(newMode: UByte): BatchableCommand<Response>`: Batchable version of `changeToMode`.
*   `suspend fun update(init: MutableAttributes.() -> Unit): RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetMode`: Creates a mutable copy, mutates it, and saves it.
## Properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetMode>`
*   `currentMode: UByte?`: The current mode of the device.
*   `onMode: UByte?`: The value of `currentMode` that depends on the `OnOff` cluster state.
*   `startUpMode: UByte?`: The mode the device enters on power-up.
*   `supportedModes: List<ModeOptionStruct>?`: The modes supported by the device.
*   `featureMap: Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
---END TEXT---

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DoorLockTrait.DlStatus ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DoorLockTrait.DlStatus ---
# enum DoorLockTrait.DlStatus
Represents door lock statuses.
### Enum Values
*   `Success`: The operation was successful.
*   `Failure`: The operation failed.
*   `Occupied`: The provided User ID, Credential ID, or entry location is already occupied.
*   `NotFound`: The specified resource was not found.
*   `ResourceExhausted`: A resource has been exhausted.
*   `InvalidField`: Operation failed due to an invalid field.
*   `Duplicate`: The provided credential is a duplicate of an existing entry.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
### Properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OccupancySensing ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OccupancySensing ---
# interface OccupancySensing
API for the OccupancySensing trait, providing an interface to occupancy sensing functionality.
### Nested Types
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor for the trait's attributes.
### Functions
*   `supports(attribute: Attribute): Boolean`
*   `update(...)`: Creates a mutable copy to update the object's state.
### Properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<OccupancySensing>`
### Inherited Properties from `OccupancySensingTrait.Attributes`
*   `occupancy: OccupancySensingTrait.OccupancyBitmap?`: The sensed occupancy status.
*   `occupancySensorType: OccupancySensingTrait.OccupancySensorTypeEnum?`: The type of occupancy sensor (e.g., PIR, Ultrasonic).
*   `occupancySensorTypeBitmap: OccupancySensingTrait.OccupancySensorTypeBitmap?`: The active occupancy sensor type.
*   `pirOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay: UShort?`: Delay in seconds before PIR sensor switches to unoccupied.
*   `pirUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay: UShort?`: Delay in seconds before PIR sensor switches to occupied.
*   `pirUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold: UByte?`: Number of movement events required to trigger occupied state for PIR.
*   `ultrasonicOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay: UShort?`: Delay in seconds before ultrasonic sensor switches to unoccupied.
*   `ultrasonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay: UShort?`: Delay in seconds before ultrasonic sensor switches to occupied.
*   `ultrasonicUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold: UByte?`: Number of movement events required to trigger occupied state for ultrasonic.
*   `physicalContactOccupiedToUnoccupiedDelay: UShort?`: Delay in seconds before physical contact sensor switches to unoccupied.
*   `physicalContactUnoccupiedToOccupiedDelay: UShort?`: Delay in seconds before physical contact sensor switches to occupied.
*   `physicalContactUnoccupiedToOccupiedThreshold: UByte?`: Number of events required to trigger occupied state for physical contact.

# interface RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetModeTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetMode cluster.
### Properties
*   `supportedModes: List<ModeOptionStruct>?`: The modes supported by the device. (Read-only)
*   `currentMode: UByte?`: The current mode of the device. Must be one of the `supportedModes`. (Read-only)
*   `startUpMode: UByte?`: The mode the device enters on power-up. (Write-only)
*   `onMode: UByte?`: The value of `currentMode` that depends on the `OnOff` cluster state. (Write-only)
*   `featureMap: RefrigeratorAndTemperatureControlledCabinetModeTrait.Feature`: Bitmap of optional cluster features.
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.VideoRemoteControlDevice.GoogleTraits ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/VideoRemoteControlDevice.GoogleTraits ---
### class VideoRemoteControlDevice.GoogleTraits
Trait Container for Google Traits.
**Public Constructors**
* `GoogleTraits(traitProvider: TraitProvider)`
**Public Properties**
* `extendedApplicationLauncher: ExtendedApplicationLauncher?` - This trait supports devices which are able to switch between applications.
* `extendedChannel: ExtendedChannel?` - This trait supports devices that support TV channels on a media device.
* `extendedLevelControl: ExtendedLevelControl?` - This trait belongs to devices which have a volume control.
* `extendedMediaInput: ExtendedMediaInput?` - This trait is an extension of the Matter standard trait, `MediaInput`, and is used by devices that can switch inputs.
* `extendedMediaPlayback: ExtendedMediaPlayback?`
* `mediaActivityState: MediaActivityState?`
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DoorLockTrait.GetCredentialStatusCommand.Response ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DoorLockTrait.GetCredentialStatusCommand.Response ---
### class DoorLockTrait.GetCredentialStatusCommand.Response
Returns the status for the specified credential.
**Public Constructors**
* `Response(credentialExists: Boolean, userIndex: UShort?, creatorFabricIndex: UByte?, lastModifiedFabricIndex: UByte?, nextCredentialIndex: UShort?, credentialData: ByteArray?)` - Creates a response payload from the GetCredentialStatus command.
**Public Properties**
* `creatorFabricIndex: UByte?` - The credential's creator fabric index.
* `credentialData: ByteArray?`
* `credentialExists: Boolean` - A boolean value indicating the requested credential type and index exists and is populated for a given user index.
* `lastModifiedFabricIndex: UByte?` - The credential's last modifier fabric index.
* `nextCredentialIndex: UShort?` - The next occupied index in the database for the credential type requested.
* `userIndex: UShort?` - The credential's corresponding user index value if the credential exists.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.AcLouverPositionEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.AcLouverPositionEnum ---
### enum ThermostatTrait.AcLouverPositionEnum : Enum, ClusterEnum
The positions a louver may be in.
**Enum Values**
* `Closed` - Fully Closed.
* `Half` - Half Open.
* `Open` - Fully Open.
* `Quarter` - Quarter Open.
* `ThreeQuarters` - Three Quarters Open.
* `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.

### class LevelControlTrait.StopCommand.Request
The request payload for the Stop command.

**Public Properties**
* `optionsMask: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
* `optionsOverride: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - If the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is set to `1`, this bit overrides the corresponding bit in the `options` attribute.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum ---
### enum EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum : Enum, ClusterEnum
The fault state of the EVSE.
**Enum Values**
* `ContactDryFailure` - The EVSE detected the absence of voltage after enabling the contactor.
* `ContactWetFailure` - The EVSE detected voltage on charging pins when the contactor was open.
* `EVDisconnected` - The EVSE detected that the cable has been disconnected.
* `EmergencyStop` - The emergency stop button was pressed.
* `GroundFault` - The EVSE has an unbalanced current supply.
* `LiveNeutralSwap` - The EVSE detected a swap of the live and neutral wires.
* `MeterFailure` - The EVSE is unable to obtain electrical measurements.
* `NoError` - The EVSE is not in an error state.
* `Other` - The EVSE has detected an unknown fault.
* `OverCurrent` - The EVSE detected charging current higher than allowed by the charger.
* `OverTemperature` - The EVSE internal temperature is too high.
* `OverVoltage` - The EVSE input voltage level is too high.
* `PilotShortCircuit` - The EVSE pilot-signal amplitude short circuited to ground.
* `PowerLoss` - The EVSE has detected a loss in power.
* `PowerQuality` - The EVSE has detected a power-quality issue.
* `UnderVoltage` - The EVSE input voltage level is too low.
* `UnknownValue` - The enum value is out of range.
* `WrongPowerSupply` - The EVSE could not determine the proper power supply level.
**Public Functions**
* `valueOf(value: String): EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum` - Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
* `values(): Array<EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum>` - Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type.
**Public Properties**
* `traitId: String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum Data Type.
* `typeName: String` - Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
* `value: ULong` - Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter Application Clusters spec.

### interface ColorControlTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the ColorControl cluster.

**Public Properties**

* `colorLoopDirection: UByte?` - The current direction of the color loop. (Access: Read)

* `colorLoopStoredEnhancedHue: UShort?` - The value of `enhancedCurrentHue` before the color loop was started. (Access: Read)

* `colorPointBy: UShort?` - Normalized chromaticity value `y` for the current blue color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorPointGIntensity: UByte?` - Relative intensity of the green color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorPointGx: UShort?` - Normalized chromaticity value `x` for the current green color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorPointGy: UShort?` - Normalized chromaticity value `y` for the current green color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorPointRIntensity: UByte?` - Relative intensity of the red color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorPointRx: UShort?` - Normalized chromaticity value `x` for the current red color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorPointRy: UShort?` - Normalized chromaticity value `y` for the current red color point. (Access: Write)
* `colorTempPhysicalMaxMireds: UShort?` - The maximum mired value supported by the device. (Access: Read)
* `colorTempPhysicalMinMireds: UShort?` - The minimum mired value supported by the device. (Access: Read)
* `colorTemperatureMireds: UShort?` - A scaled inverse of the current color temperature, in mireds. (Access: Read)
* `compensationText: String?` - Textual indication of the compensation mechanism in use. (Access: Read)
* `coupleColorTempToLevelMinMireds: UShort?` - Lower bound on `colorTemperatureMireds` for coupling to `currentLevel`. (Access: Read)
* `currentHue: UByte?` - The current hue value of the light (0-254). (Access: Read)
* `currentSaturation: UByte?` - The current saturation value of the light (0-254). (Access: Read)
* `currentX: UShort?` - The current normalized chromaticity value `x`. (Access: Read)
* `currentY: UShort?` - The current normalized chromaticity value `y`. (Access: Read)
* `driftCompensation: ColorControlTrait.DriftCompensationEnum?` - The mechanism for color/intensity drift compensation. (Access: Read)
* `enhancedColorMode: ColorControlTrait.EnhancedColorModeEnum?` - The attributes currently determining the color of the device. (Access: Read)
* `enhancedCurrentHue: UShort?` - Represents non-equidistant steps along the CIE 1931 color triangle. (Access: Read)
* `featureMap: ColorControlTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
* `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
* `numberOfPrimaries: UByte?` - The number of color primaries implemented on the device. (Access: Read)
* `options: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap?` - A bitmap that determines the default behavior of some cluster commands. (Access: Write)
* `primary1Intensity: UByte?` - Maximum intensity of primary 1. (Access: Read)
* `primary1X: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `x` for primary 1. (Access: Read)
* `primary1Y: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `y` for primary 1. (Access: Read)
* `primary2Intensity: UByte?` - Maximum intensity of primary 2. (Access: Read)
* `primary2X: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `x` for primary 2. (Access: Read)
* `primary2Y: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `y` for primary 2. (Access: Read)
* `primary3Intensity: UByte?` - Maximum intensity of primary 3. (Access: Read)
* `primary3X: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `x` for primary 3. (Access: Read)
* `primary3Y: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `y` for primary 3. (Access: Read)
* `primary4Intensity: UByte?` - Maximum intensity of primary 4. (Access: Read)
* `primary4X: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `x` for primary 4. (Access: Read)
* `primary4Y: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `y` for primary 4. (Access: Read)

* `primary6X: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `x` for primary 6. (Access: Read)
* `primary6Y: UShort?` - Chromaticity value `y` for primary 6. (Access: Read)

* `whitePointY: UShort?` - Normalized chromaticity value `y` for the current white point. (Access: Write)

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.SlotStruct ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.SlotStruct ---
### class DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.SlotStruct
Indicates a specific stage of an ESA's operation.
**Public Constructors**
* `SlotStruct(minDuration: UInt, maxDuration: UInt, defaultDuration: UInt, ...)`
**Public Properties**
* `costs: OptionalValue<List<DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CostStruct>>` - The current estimated cost of operating the appliance.
* `defaultDuration: UInt` - The expected time, in seconds, that the appliance will be in its slot.
* `elapsedSlotTime: UInt` - The time, in seconds, that has already elapsed in the slot.
* `manufacturerEsaState: OptionalValue<UShort>` - A manufacturer-defined value indicating the ESA state.
* `maxDuration: UInt` - The maximum time, in seconds, the appliance is expected to be in its slot.
* `maxDurationAdjustment: OptionalValue<UInt>` - The maximum duration, in seconds, the slot's usage can be extended.
* `maxPauseDuration: OptionalValue<UInt>` - The maximum time, in seconds, the slot can be paused.
* `maxPower: OptionalValue<Long>` - The highest power, in milliwatts, the appliance is expected to use in its current slot.
* `maxPowerAdjustment: OptionalValue<Long>` - The maximum power adjustment, in milliwatts, the ESA can be requested to use.
* `minDuration: UInt` - The minimum time, in seconds, the appliance is expected to be in its slot.
* `minDurationAdjustment: OptionalValue<UInt>` - The minimum time, in seconds, the slot's usage can be shortened.
* `minPauseDuration: OptionalValue<UInt>` - The shortest time, in seconds, the slot can be paused.
* `minPower: OptionalValue<Long>` - The lowest power, in milliwatts, the appliance is expected to use in its current slot.
* `minPowerAdjustment: OptionalValue<Long>` - The minimum power adjustment, in milliwatts, the ESA can be requested to use.
* `nominalEnergy: OptionalValue<Long>` - The amount of energy the appliance is expected to use or produce in its current slot.
* `nominalPower: OptionalValue<Long>` - The expected power the appliance will use in its current slot.
* `remainingSlotTime: UInt` - The remaining time, in seconds, the appliance is expected to be in its slot.
* `slotIsPauseable: OptionalValue<Boolean>` - Indicates whether this slot can be paused.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatCommands ---
### interface ThermostatCommands
**Known direct subclasses:** `Thermostat`
**Public Functions**
* `atomicRequest(requestType: ThermostatTrait.AtomicRequestTypeEnum, attributeRequests: List<UInt>, optionalArgs: ...): suspend ThermostatTrait.AtomicRequestCommand.Response` - Begin, commit, or cancel an atomic write.
* `atomicRequestBatchable(requestType: ThermostatTrait.AtomicRequestTypeEnum, attributeRequests: List<UInt>, optionalArgs: ...): BatchableCommand<...>` - The batchable version of `atomicRequest` command.
* `clearWeeklySchedule(): suspend Unit` - Deprecated and not supported.
* `clearWeeklyScheduleBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>` - The batchable version of `clearWeeklySchedule` command.
* `getWeeklySchedule(daysToReturn: ..., modeToReturn: ...): suspend ThermostatTrait.GetWeeklyScheduleCommand.Response` - Deprecated and not supported.
* `getWeeklyScheduleBatchable(daysToReturn: ..., modeToReturn: ...): BatchableCommand<...>` - The batchable version of `getWeeklySchedule` command.
* `setActivePresetRequest(presetHandle: ByteArray?): suspend Unit`
* `setActivePresetRequestBatchable(presetHandle: ByteArray?): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
* `setActiveScheduleRequest(scheduleHandle: ByteArray): suspend Unit`
* `setActiveScheduleRequestBatchable(scheduleHandle: ByteArray): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
* `setWeeklySchedule(numberOfTransitionsForSequence: UByte, dayOfWeekForSequence: ..., modeForSequence: ..., transitions: ...): suspend Unit` - Deprecated and not supported.
* `setWeeklyScheduleBatchable(numberOfTransitionsForSequence: UByte, dayOfWeekForSequence: ..., modeForSequence: ..., transitions: ...): BatchableCommand<Unit>` - The batchable version of `setWeeklySchedule` command.
* `setpointRaiseLower(mode: ThermostatTrait.SetpointRaiseLowerModeEnum, amount: Byte): suspend Unit` - Change the setpoint for the current thermostat mode.
* `setpointRaiseLowerBatchable(mode: ThermostatTrait.SetpointRaiseLowerModeEnum, amount: Byte): BatchableCommand<Unit>` - The batchable version of `setpointRaiseLower` command.

# data class DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.Feature : ClusterBitmap
DeviceEnergyManagement trait FeatureMap.
## Public constructors

## Public functions
- `toRaw(): ULong`
## Public properties
- `constraintBasedAdjustment: Boolean`: Allows an EMS to request constraints to an ESA's planned operation.
- `forecastAdjustment: Boolean`: Allows an EMS to adjust an ESA's planned operation.
- `pausable: Boolean`: Allows an EMS to pause an ESA's planned operation.
- `powerAdjustment: Boolean`: Allows an EMS to make a temporary power adjustment within the limits offered by the ESA.
- `powerForecastReporting: Boolean`: Allows an ESA to advertise its indicative future power consumption vs time.
- `startTimeAdjustment: Boolean`: Allows an EMS to delay an ESA's planned operation.
- `stateForecastReporting: Boolean`: Allows an ESA to advertise its indicative future state vs time.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OperationalStateTrait.Attributes ---

# interface OperationalStateTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the OperationalState cluster.
## Public properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
- `countdownTime: UInt?`: The estimated time, in seconds, before the operation completes. (Read-only)
- `currentPhase: UByte?`: The current phase of operation being performed by the server. (Read-only)
- `featureMap: UInt`: Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.
- `operationalError: OperationalStateTrait.ErrorStateStruct?`: Details of any current error condition when the `operationalState` attribute is Error. (Read-only)
- `operationalState: OperationalStateTrait.OperationalStateEnum?`: The current operational state of the device. (Read-only)
- `operationalStateList: List<OperationalStateTrait.OperationalStateStruct>?`: The set of possible operational states that the device exposes. (Read-only)
- `phaseList: List<String>?`: The set of phases that the device can go through for the selected function or mode. (Read-only)

# interface MessagesTrait.MessageQueued
This event is sent when a message is added to the `messages` attribute.
## Public properties
- `messageId: ByteArray?`: The `messageID` for the message being queued.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.StepHueCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.StepHueCommand.Request ---
# class ColorControlTrait.StepHueCommand.Request
The request payload for the StepHue command.
## Public constructors
- `Request(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, transitionTime: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Creates a request payload for the StepHue command.
## Public properties
- `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
- `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: If the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is 1, this overrides the corresponding bit in the `options` attribute.
- `stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum`: The direction in which to move the hue.
- `stepSize: UByte`: The amount of units to move the device's `currentHue` to.
- `transitionTime: UByte`: The time (in 0.1 seconds) taken to move the device to the new hue.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum ---
# IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum
`enum IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum : Enum, ClusterEnum`
The identification state presented to the user.
### Enum Values
*   `Actuator`: The identification state is conveyed by actuator functionality, such as through a window blind operation or in-wall relay.
*   `AudibleBeep`: The identification state is conveyed by an audible beep.
*   `Display`: The identification state is visible on a display.
*   `LightOutput`: The identification state is conveyed by the lighting output of a lighting product.
*   `None`: The identification state is not presented to the user.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
*   `VisibleIndicator`: The identification state is conveyed by an indicator on the device, such as a small LED.
### Public properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum Data Type.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to, in UpperCamelCase.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter Application Clusters spec.
### Public functions
*   `valueOf(value: String): IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum`: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
*   `values(): Array<IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum>`: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared.

# ThermostatTrait.WeeklyScheduleTransitionStruct
`class ThermostatTrait.WeeklyScheduleTransitionStruct : ClusterStruct`
A single transition in a thermostat schedule.
### Public constructors
*   `WeeklyScheduleTransitionStruct(transitionTime: UShort, heatSetpoint: Short?, coolSetpoint: Short?)`: Creates the WeeklyScheduleTransitionStruct class.
### Public properties
*   `coolSetpoint: Short?`: The cooling setpoint applied at the transition time.
*   `heatSetpoint: Short?`: The heating setpoint applied at the transition time.
*   `transitionTime: UShort`: The start time of the schedule transition, expressed as the minutes since midnight.

*   `getFieldValueById(tagId: UInt): Any?`: Returns the value of the field for the given tag ID.

# ModeSelectCommands
`interface ModeSelectCommands`
Known direct subclasses: `ModeSelect` (API for the ModeSelect trait).
### Public functions
*   `suspend fun changeToMode(newMode: UByte)`: Change the mode of the device's cluster instance, and set the `currentMode` attribute.
    *   `newMode: UByte`: The mode to set the cluster instance to. This must be one of the values in `ModeOptionStruct`.
*   `fun changeToModeBatchable(newMode: UByte): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: The batchable version of `changeToMode` command.
    *   `newMode: UByte`: The mode to set the cluster instance to. This must be one of the values in `ModeOptionStruct`.
    *   **Returns**: `BatchableCommand<Unit>`
