--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ContentLauncherTrait.ParameterEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ContentLauncherTrait.ParameterEnum ---
# ContentLauncherTrait.ParameterEnum
`enum ContentLauncherTrait.ParameterEnum : Enum, ClusterEnum`
Content data elements that may be searched on.
### Enum Values
*   `Actor`: An actor credited in video media content.
*   `Any`
*   `Channel`: The identifying data for a television channel, for example, 'PBS'.
*   `Character`: A character represented in video media content.
*   `Director`: A director of the video media content.
*   `Episode`
*   `Event`: A reference to a type of event.
*   `Franchise`: A video entity which can represent a number of video entities, like movies or TV shows.
*   `Genre`: The genre of video media content such as action, drama or comedy.
*   `League`: The categorical information for a sporting league.
*   `Popularity`: Indicates whether the user is requesting popular content.
*   `Provider`: The media provider that the user wants this media to be played on.
*   `Season`
*   `Sport`: The categorical information of a sport, for example, football.
*   `SportsTeam`: The categorical information of a professional sports team.
*   `Type`: The type of content requested.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
*   `Video`: The identifying data for a specific piece of video content.
### Public properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum Data Type.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to, in UpperCamelCase.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter Application Clusters spec.
### Public functions
*   `valueOf(value: String): ContentLauncherTrait.ParameterEnum`: Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
*   `values(): Array<ContentLauncherTrait.ParameterEnum>`: Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they're declared.

# DishwasherAlarmTrait.Attributes
`interface DishwasherAlarmTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the DishwasherAlarm cluster.
Known direct subclasses: `DishwasherAlarm` (API for the DishwasherAlarm trait).
### Public properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `featureMap: DishwasherAlarmTrait.Feature`: Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `latch: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap?`: Indicates which alarms remain active until explicitly reset. (Access: Read)
*   `mask: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap?`: A bitmap indicating an enabled alarm. (Access: Read)
*   `state: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap?`: The alarm's current status. (Access: Read)
*   `supported: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap?`: The available alarms. (Access: Read)

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvse ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvse ---
# EnergyEvse
`interface EnergyEvse : EnergyEvseTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait, Updatable, EnergyEvseCommands`
API for the EnergyEvse trait. This trait is for devices that provide electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) functionality.
### Nested types
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Command`: Descriptor enum for this trait's commands.
### Public properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<EnergyEvse>`
### Public functions
*   `supports(attribute: EnergyEvse.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: EnergyEvse.Command): Boolean`
### Inherited functions
*   From `com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseCommands`:
    *   `clearTargets()`: Allows a client to clear all stored charging targets.
    *   `disable()`: Disables the EVSE from charging and discharging.
    *   `enableCharging(...)`: Enables the EVSE to charge an electric vehicle.
    *   `enableDischarging(...)`: Enables the EVSE to discharge an electric vehicle.
    *   `getTargets()`: Allows a client to retrieve the current set of charging targets.
    *   `setTargets(...)`: Allows a client to set user-specified charging targets.
    *   `startDiagnostics()`: Puts the EVSE into self-diagnostics mode.
    *   Batchable versions of all the above commands are available (e.g., `clearTargetsBatchable()`).
*   From `com.google.home.Updatable`:
    *   `update(...)`: Creates a mutable copy of an object, mutates it, saves it, and returns a new immutable copy.
### Inherited properties
*   From `com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseTrait.Attributes`:
    *   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported client-generated commands.
    *   `approximateEvEfficiency: UShort?`: The vehicle efficiency rating.
    *   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: Supported attribute IDs.
    *   `batteryCapacity: Long?`: EV battery capacity in mWh.
    *   `chargingEnabledUntil: UInt?`: UTC time when charging automatically stops.
    *   `circuitCapacity: Long?`: Capacity the EVSE circuit can provide.
    *   `clusterRevision: UShort`: Cluster specification revision.
    *   `dischargingEnabledUntil: UInt?`: UTC time when discharging automatically stops.
    *   `faultState: EnergyEvseTrait.FaultStateEnum?`: The type of fault detected.
    *   `featureMap: EnergyEvseTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
    *   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported server-generated commands.
    *   `maximumChargeCurrent: Long?`: Max current EVSE can deliver (mA).
    *   `maximumDischargeCurrent: Long?`: Max current EVSE can receive (mA).
    *   `minimumChargeCurrent: Long?`: Min current EVSE can deliver (mA).
    *   `nextChargeRequiredEnergy: Long?`: Energy (MWh) for the next charging target.
    *   `nextChargeStartTime: UInt?`: UTC time for the next scheduled charge start.
    *   `nextChargeTargetSoC: UByte?`: Target state of charge (%) for the next charge.
    *   `nextChargeTargetTime: UInt?`: UTC time to complete the next scheduled charge.
    *   `randomizationDelayWindow: UInt?`: Randomization window for charging start (seconds).
    *   `sessionDuration: UInt?`: Duration of the current/last session (seconds).
    *   `sessionEnergyCharged: Long?`: Energy delivered (mWh) in the current/last session.
    *   `sessionEnergyDischarged: Long?`: Energy received (mWh) in the current/last session.
    *   `sessionId: UInt?`: Unique identifier for the current/last session.
    *   `state: EnergyEvseTrait.StateEnum?`: Current status of the EVSE.
    *   `stateOfCharge: UByte?`: EV battery state of charge (%).
    *   `supplyState: EnergyEvseTrait.SupplyStateEnum?`: Indicates if EV is allowed to charge/discharge.
    *   `userMaximumChargeCurrent: Long?`: Max current set by consumer preference (mA).
    *   `vehicleId: String?`: Vehicle ID read via ISO-15118.
*   From `com.google.home.Trait`:
    *   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

- `peakMeasuredValue: Float?`: Maximum `measuredValue` during `peakMeasuredValueWindow`. (Read-only)
- `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: Time window in seconds for `peakMeasuredValue`. (Read-only)

### Inherited Functions
- **From `TraitStateInvalidation`**:
    - `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
- **From `Updatable`**:
    - `update(...): suspend Binding`: Creates a mutable copy, mutates it, saves it, and returns a new immutable copy.

- **From `BindingTrait.Attributes`**:
    - `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`
    - `attributeList: List<UInt>`

    - `clusterRevision: UShort`
    - `featureMap: UInt`
    - `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`
- **From `Trait`**:
    - `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

# interface MediaInputCommands
### Functions
- `hideInputStatus(): suspend Unit`: Hide the input list on the display.
- `hideInputStatusBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: Batchable version of `hideInputStatus`.
- `renameInput(index: UByte, name: String): suspend Unit`: Change the name of the specified input.
- `renameInputBatchable(index: UByte, name: String): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: Batchable version of `renameInput`.
- `selectInput(index: UByte): suspend Unit`: Change the media input on the device.
- `selectInputBatchable(index: UByte): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: Batchable version of `selectInput`.
- `showInputStatus(): suspend Unit`: Show the input list on the display.
- `showInputStatusBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: Batchable version of `showInputStatus`.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.ControlModeEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.ControlModeEnum ---
### `enum PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.ControlModeEnum`
> The various modes of controlling the pump.
#### Enum Values
*   `Automatic`: The pump's operation is automatically optimized for comfort and energy savings.
*   `ConstantFlow`: The pump regulates its speed to maintain a constant flow.
*   `ConstantPressure`: The pump regulates its speed to maintain a constant differential pressure over its flanges.
*   `ConstantSpeed`: The pump runs at a constant speed.
*   `ConstantTemperature`: The pump regulates its speed to maintain a constant temperature.
*   `ProportionalPressure`: The pump regulates its speed to maintain a constant differential pressure over its flanges.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
#### Properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter spec.

### `interface ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.Attributes`
> Attributes for the ElectricalEnergyMeasurement cluster.
#### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.

*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `cumulativeEnergyExported: ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.EnergyMeasurementStruct?`: The most recent measurement of cumulative energy exported over the lifetime of the device. (Read-only)
*   `cumulativeEnergyImported: ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.EnergyMeasurementStruct?`: The most recent measurement of cumulative energy imported over the lifetime of the device. (Read-only)
*   `cumulativeEnergyReset: ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.CumulativeEnergyResetStruct?`: Indicates when cumulative measurements were most recently zero. (Read-only)
*   `featureMap: ElectricalEnergyMeasurementTrait.Feature`: Indicates support for optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.

> The request payload for the MoveColorTemperature command.

*   `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden.
*   `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in the `options` attribute based on `optionsMask`.
*   `rate: UShort`: The rate of change in steps per second for `colorTemperatureMireds`.

*   `Unlocked`: Fully unlocked.

- `PPT`: Parts per trillion.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.UnitTestingCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/UnitTestingCommands ---
# `interface UnitTestingCommands`
API for the UnitTesting trait.
### Functions
- `globalEchoRequest(field1: UnitTestingTrait.TestGlobalStruct, field2: UnitTestingTrait.TestGlobalEnum): Response`
  - Also available as `globalEchoRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `simpleStructEchoRequest(arg1: UnitTestingTrait.SimpleStruct): Response`: Unit test command.
  - **Parameters:** `arg1` (`SimpleStruct`): `SimpleStruct` argument.
  - Also available as `simpleStructEchoRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `stringEchoRequest(payload: ByteArray): Response`
  - Also available as `stringEchoRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `test(): Unit`: Simple command without any parameters and without a specific response.
  - Also available as `testBatchable()`.
- `testAddArguments(arg1: UByte, arg2: UByte): Response`: Simple command that adds the two arguments.
  - Also available as `testAddArgumentsBatchable(...)`.
- `testBatchHelperRequest(sleepBeforeResponseTimeMs: UShort, sizeOfResponseBuffer: UShort, fillCharacter: UByte): Response`
  - Also available as `testBatchHelperRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testComplexNullableOptionalRequest(nullableInt: UShort?, nullableString: String?, nullableStruct: UnitTestingTrait.SimpleStruct?, nullableList: List<UnitTestingTrait.SimpleEnum>?, optionalArgs: ...): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testComplexNullableOptionalRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testDifferentVendorMeiRequest(arg1: UByte): Response`
  - Also available as `testDifferentVendorMeiRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testEmitTestEventRequest(arg1: UByte, arg2: UnitTestingTrait.SimpleEnum, arg3: Boolean): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testEmitTestEventRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testEmitTestFabricScopedEventRequest(arg1: UByte): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testEmitTestFabricScopedEventRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testEnumsRequest(arg1: UShort, arg2: UnitTestingTrait.SimpleEnum): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testEnumsRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testListInt8UArgumentRequest(arg1: List<UByte>): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testListInt8UArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testListInt8UReverseRequest(arg1: List<UByte>): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testListInt8UReverseRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testListNestedStructListArgumentRequest(arg1: List<UnitTestingTrait.NestedStructList>): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testListNestedStructListArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testListStructArgumentRequest(arg1: List<UnitTestingTrait.SimpleStruct>): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testListStructArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testNestedStructArgumentRequest(arg1: UnitTestingTrait.NestedStruct): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testNestedStructArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testNestedStructListArgumentRequest(arg1: UnitTestingTrait.NestedStructList): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testNestedStructListArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testNotHandled(): Unit`: Simple command not handled by the server.
  - Also available as `testNotHandledBatchable()`.
- `testNullableOptionalRequest(optionalArgs: ...): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testNullableOptionalRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testSecondBatchHelperRequest(sleepBeforeResponseTimeMs: UShort, sizeOfResponseBuffer: UShort, fillCharacter: UByte): Response`
  - Also available as `testSecondBatchHelperRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testSimpleArgumentRequest(arg1: Boolean): Response`: Command that takes a boolean argument.
  - Also available as `testSimpleArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testSimpleOptionalArgumentRequest(optionalArgs: ...): Unit`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testSimpleOptionalArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testSpecific(): Response`: Simple command without parameters and with a specific response.
  - Also available as `testSpecificBatchable()`.
- `testStructArgumentRequest(arg1: UnitTestingTrait.SimpleStruct): Response`: Unit test command.
  - Also available as `testStructArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testStructArrayArgumentRequest(arg1: List<...>, arg2: List<...>, ...): Response`: Command that takes various array arguments.
  - Also available as `testStructArrayArgumentRequestBatchable(...)`.
- `testUnknownCommand(): Unit`: Simple command that should not be added to the server.
  - Also available as `testUnknownCommandBatchable()`.
- `timedInvokeRequest(): Unit`: TimedInvokeRequest command.
  - Also available as `timedInvokeRequestBatchable()`.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.MoveSaturationCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.MoveSaturationCommand.Request ---
# `class ColorControlTrait.MoveSaturationCommand.Request`
The request payload for the MoveSaturation command.
### Constructors
- `Request(moveMode: ColorControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`
### Properties
- `moveMode: ColorControlTrait.MoveModeEnum`: The direction in which to move the saturation.
- `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in `options` should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
- `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in `options` if the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is set.
- `rate: UByte`: The rate (in steps per second) to change `currentSaturation`.

# `class DoorLockTrait.GetWeekDayScheduleCommand.Response`
Returns the weekly repeating schedule data for the specified schedule index.
### Constructors

- `endHour: UByte?`: The ending hour for the schedule.
- `endMinute: UByte?`: The ending minute for the schedule.
- `startHour: UByte?`: The starting hour for the schedule.
- `startMinute: UByte?`: The starting minute for the schedule.
- `status: DoorLockTrait.DlStatus`: The status of the command.
- `userIndex: UShort`: The unique identifier for the user.
- `weekDayIndex: UByte`: The unique identifier for the week day schedule.

# `interface DeviceEnergyManagementMode`
API for the DeviceEnergyManagementMode trait. Defines additional mode tags and namespaced enumerated values for device energy management devices.
### Nested Types
- `enum Attribute`: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
- `enum Command`: Descriptor for this trait's commands.
### Functions
- `supports(attribute: DeviceEnergyManagementMode.Attribute): Boolean`
- `supports(command: DeviceEnergyManagementMode.Command): Boolean`
- `suspend forceRead(): Unit` (Inherited)
- `suspend update(...)` (Inherited)

- `changeToMode(newMode: UByte): Response`: Change device modes.
  - Also available as `changeToModeBatchable(...)`.
### Properties

- `featureMap: DeviceEnergyManagementModeTrait.Feature`
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`
- `onMode: UByte?`: The value of `currentMode` that depends on the state of an `OnOff` cluster.
- `startUpMode: UByte?`: The desired startup mode when the device is powered on.
- `supportedModes: List<DeviceEnergyManagementModeTrait.ModeOptionStruct>?`: The modes supported by the device.

--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DoorLockTrait.LockOperationTypeEnum ---
# `enum DoorLockTrait.LockOperationTypeEnum`
The type of Lock operation performed.
### Enum Values
- `ForcedUserEvent`: Triggered by a user with `UserTypeEnum` set to `ForcedUser`.
- `Lock`: Lock operation.
- `NonAccessUserEvent`: Triggered by keypad entry for a Non-Access User.
- `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
- `Unlatch`: Unlatch event.
- `Unlock`: Unlock operation.
### Functions
- `valueOf(value: String): DoorLockTrait.LockOperationTypeEnum`
- `values(): Array<DoorLockTrait.LockOperationTypeEnum>`
### Properties
- `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum.
- `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
- `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter spec.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.LevelControlTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LevelControlTrait.Attributes ---
# `interface LevelControlTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the LevelControl cluster.
### Properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.
- `currentFrequency: UShort?` (Read-only): The frequency at which the device is at `currentLevel`.
- `currentLevel: UByte?` (Read-only): The current level of the device (e.g., brightness).
- `defaultMoveRate: UByte?` (Write-only): The movement rate (units/sec) for `move` commands with a null `rate`.
- `featureMap: LevelControlTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
- `maxFrequency: UShort?` (Read-only): The maximum value for `currentFrequency`.
- `maxLevel: UByte?` (Read-only): The maximum value for `currentLevel`.
- `minFrequency: UShort?` (Read-only): The minimum value for `currentFrequency`.
- `minLevel: UByte?` (Read-only): The minimum value for `currentLevel`.
- `offTransitionTime: UShort?` (Write-only): Time (in 0.1s) to move from `maxLevel` to `minLevel` on an `off` command.
- `onLevel: UByte?` (Write-only): The value `currentLevel` is set to when the device is turned on.
- `onOffTransitionTime: UShort?` (Write-only): Time (in 0.1s) to transition levels on `on`/`off` commands.
- `onTransitionTime: UShort?` (Write-only): Time (in 0.1s) to move from `minLevel` to `maxLevel` on an `on` command.
- `options: LevelControlTrait.OptionsBitmap?` (Write-only): Bitmap that determines default command behavior.
- `remainingTime: UShort?` (Read-only): Time remaining (in 0.1s) until the current command is complete.
- `startUpCurrentLevel: UByte?` (Write-only): The desired startup level for the device when powered on.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.OccupancyBitmap ---

# `enum ActivatedCarbonFilterMonitoringTrait.ChangeIndicationEnum`
The condition of the activated carbon filter.
### Enum Values
- `Critical`: The activated carbon filter needs replacement.
- `OK`: The activated carbon filter is in good condition.
- `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
- `Warning`: The activated carbon filter will need replacing soon.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum ---
# IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum
`enum IdentifyTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum : Enum, ClusterEnum`
The effect to use for an identification state or triggered effect.
### Enum Values
*   `Blink`: A blinking effect, such as a light turned on and off once.
*   `Breathe`: A breathing effect, such as slowly turning a light on and off over 1 second, repeated multiple times.
*   `ChannelChange`: An effect that indicates a channel changes, such as a light turning orange for 8 seconds.
*   `FinishEffect`: The current effect sequence is completed before terminating.
*   `Okay`: An effect that indicates an okay state, such as a light turning green for a second.
*   `StopEffect`: The effect is terminated as soon as possible.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
### Properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum Data Type.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to, in UpperCamelCase.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter Application Clusters spec.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.RvcOperationalStateTrait.OperationalError ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/RvcOperationalStateTrait.OperationalError ---
# RvcOperationalStateTrait.OperationalError
`interface RvcOperationalStateTrait.OperationalError`
This event is generated when a reportable error condition is detected.
### Properties
*   `errorState: RvcOperationalStateTrait.ErrorStateStruct?`: An enumeration range or generally applicable values that indicate specific errors.
    *   **`errorStateId` Ranges:**
        | Range | Name | Description |
        |---|---|---|
        | `0x00` to `0x3F` | **GeneralErrors** | General errors. |
        | `0x40` to `0x7F` | **DerivedClusterErrors** | Derived cluster-specific errors. |
        | `0x80` to `0xBF` | **ManufacturerError** | Vendor-specific errors. |
    *   **Generally Applicable `errorStateId` Values:**
        | Value | Name | Description |
        |---|---|---|
        | `0x00` | **NoError** | When the device is not in an error state. |
        | `0x01` | **UnableToStartOrResume** | When the device is unable to start or resume operation. |
        | `0x02` | **UnableToCompleteOperation** | When the device is unable to complete the current operation. |
        | `0x03` | **CommandInvalidInState** | When the device cannot process the command in its current state. |

### interface `DishwasherAlarmCommands`
**Public Functions:**
*   `suspend fun modifyEnabledAlarms(mask: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap): Unit`: Modifies an enabled alarm.
    *   `mask`: A bitmap indicating an alarm that should be enabled or suppressed.
*   `fun modifyEnabledAlarmsBatchable(mask: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: Batchable version of `modifyEnabledAlarms`.
*   `suspend fun reset(alarms: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap): Unit`: Resets active and, if possible, latched alarms.
    *   `alarms`: A bitmap indicating an alarm that will be reset.
*   `fun resetBatchable(alarms: DishwasherAlarmTrait.AlarmBitmap): BatchableCommand<Unit>`: Batchable version of `reset`.

*   `transitionTime: UShort`: The time (in 0.1 seconds) for the transition.
*   `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden.
*   `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in `options` attribute if the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is set.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ChannelTrait.StatusEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ChannelTrait.StatusEnum ---
# enum ChannelTrait.StatusEnum
Statuses for channel selection commands.
### Enum Values
*   `MultipleMatches`: More than one match for the specified channel was found.
*   `NoMatches`: No matches for the specified channel were found.
*   `Success`: The command succeeded.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
### Properties
*   `traitId`: `open String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the enum Data Type.
*   `typeName`: `open String` - Name of the Matter Data Type that the enum belongs to.
*   `value`: `open ULong` - Integer identifier of the enum value per the Matter Application Clusters spec.
### Functions
*   `valueOf(value: String)`: `ChannelTrait.StatusEnum` - Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
*   `values()`: `Array<ChannelTrait.StatusEnum>` - Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.IdentifyTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/IdentifyTrait.Attributes ---
# interface IdentifyTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the Identify cluster.
### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `attributeList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
*   `clusterRevision`: `UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
*   `featureMap`: `UInt` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands (server to client) which are supported by this cluster server instance.
*   `identifyTime`: `UShort?` - The remaining length of time, in seconds, that the endpoint will continue to identify itself. (Access type: Write)
*   `identifyType`: `IdentifyTrait.IdentifyTypeEnum?` - How the identification state is presented to the user. (Access type: Read)

# enum LaundryWasherControlsTrait.NumberOfRinsesEnum

# class RefrigeratorDevice.GoogleTraits
Trait Container for Google Traits.
### Constructor
*   `GoogleTraits(traitProvider: TraitProvider)`
### Properties

# enum ColorControlTrait.SaturationMoveMode
The direction in which to move a device's saturation.
### Enum Values
*   `Down`: Decrease the device's saturation at a given rate.
*   `Stop`: Stops a command that is currently moving a device's saturation.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
*   `Up`: Increase the device's saturation at a given rate.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.Actions ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/Actions ---
# interface Actions
API for the Actions trait. This trait provides a standardized way for a node to expose information about logical grouping of endpoints, named actions, commands to trigger actions, and events for feedback.
### Nested Types
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Command`: Descriptor enum for this trait's commands.
### Functions
*   `supports(attribute: Actions.Attribute)`: `Boolean`
*   `supports(command: Actions.Command)`: `Boolean`
### Properties
*   `factory`: `open TraitFactory<Actions>`
### Inherited Commands
*   `disableAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Disable an action.
*   `disableActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, ...)`: Disable an action for a specified amount of time, then enable it.
*   `enableAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Enable an action.
*   `enableActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, ...)`: Enable an action for a specified amount of time, then disable it.
*   `instantAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Trigger an action (state change) on endpoints in an asynchronous manner.
*   `instantActionWithTransition(actionId: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, ...)`: Trigger an action (state change) on endpoints, specifying how long the state change should take.
*   `pauseAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Pause an ongoing action.
*   `pauseActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, ...)`: Pause an ongoing action for a specified amount of time, after which it resumes.
*   `resumeAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Resume a paused action.
*   `startAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Start an action.
*   `startActionWithDuration(actionId: UShort, duration: UInt, ...)`: Start an action, allow it to run for a specified amount of time, after which it stops.
*   `stopAction(actionId: UShort, ...)`: Stop the ongoing action.
*   `forceRead()`: `suspend Unit`
### Inherited Attributes
*   `acceptedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster.
*   `actionList`: `List<ActionsTrait.ActionStruct>?`
*   `attributeList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster.
*   `clusterRevision`: `UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `endpointLists`: `List<ActionsTrait.EndpointListStruct>?` - A list of endpoint list IDs.
*   `featureMap`: `UInt` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster.
*   `setupUrl`: `String?` - A URL with information about the cluster's capabilities.
*   `metadata`: `Trait.TraitMetadata`

# interface PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.Attributes
Attributes for the PumpConfigurationAndControl cluster.
### Properties
*   `acceptedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster.
*   `attributeList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster.
*   `capacity`: `Short?` - The actual capacity of the pump as a percentage of the effective maximum setpoint value. (Access type: Read)
*   `clusterRevision`: `UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `controlMode`: `PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.ControlModeEnum?` - The control mode of the pump. (Access type: Write)
*   `effectiveControlMode`: `PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.ControlModeEnum?` - The current effective control mode of the pump. (Access type: Read)
*   `effectiveOperationMode`: `PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.OperationModeEnum?` - The current effective operation mode of the pump. (Access type: Read)
*   `featureMap`: `PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster.
*   `lifetimeEnergyConsumed`: `UInt?` - The accumulated energy consumption through the entire lifetime of the pump in kWh. (Access type: Write)
*   `lifetimeRunningHours`: `UInt?` - The accumulated number of hours that the pump has been powered and the motor has been running. (Access type: Write)
*   `maxCompPressure`: `Short?` - The maximum compensated pressure the pump can achieve. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxConstFlow`: `UShort?` - The maximum flow the pump can achieve in `ConstantFlow` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxConstPressure`: `Short?` - The maximum pressure the pump can achieve in `ConstantPressure` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxConstSpeed`: `UShort?` - The maximum speed the pump can achieve in `ConstantSpeed` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxConstTemp`: `Short?` - The maximum temperature the pump can maintain in `ConstantTemperature` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxFlow`: `UShort?` - The maximum flow the pump can achieve. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxPressure`: `Short?` - The maximum pressure the pump can achieve. (Access type: Read)
*   `maxSpeed`: `UShort?` - The maximum speed the pump can achieve. (Access type: Read)
*   `minCompPressure`: `Short?` - The minimum compensated pressure the pump can achieve. (Access type: Read)
*   `minConstFlow`: `UShort?` - The minimum flow the pump can achieve in `ConstantFlow` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `minConstPressure`: `Short?` - The minimum pressure the pump can achieve in `ConstantPressure` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `minConstSpeed`: `UShort?` - The minimum speed the pump can achieve in `ConstantSpeed` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `minConstTemp`: `Short?` - The minimum temperature the pump can maintain in `ConstantTemperature` mode. (Access type: Read)
*   `operationMode`: `PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.OperationModeEnum?` - The operation mode of the pump. (Access type: Write)
*   `power`: `UInt?` - The actual power consumption of the pump in watts. (Access type: Read)
*   `pumpStatus`: `PumpConfigurationAndControlTrait.PumpStatusBitmap?` - The activity status of the pump functions. (Access type: Read)
*   `speed`: `UShort?` - The actual speed of the pump measured in RPM. (Access type: Read)

# DoorLockTrait.DlRfidOperationEventMask
`data class DoorLockTrait.DlRfidOperationEventMask`
Event mask to enable/disable the transmission of RFID events.
### Constructor
- `DlRfidOperationEventMask(unknown: Boolean, lock: Boolean, unlock: Boolean, lockInvalidRfid: Boolean, lockInvalidSchedule: Boolean, unlockInvalidRfid: Boolean, unlockInvalidSchedule: Boolean)`
### Functions
- `fun toRaw(): ULong`: Converts this bitmap to raw format.
### Properties
- `val bitmapName: String`: Name of the Matter bitmap (e.g., "OnOffControlBitmap").
- `val lock: Boolean`: RFID-triggered Lock event.
- `val lockInvalidRfid: Boolean`: RFID-triggered Lock event with 'invalid RFID ID' error.
- `val lockInvalidSchedule: Boolean`: RFID-triggered Lock event with 'invalid schedule' error.
- `val traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
- `val unknown: Boolean`: Unknown or manufacturer-specific remote operation event.
- `val unlock: Boolean`: RFID-triggered Unlock event.
- `val unlockInvalidRfid: Boolean`: RFID-triggered Lock event with 'invalid RFID ID' error.
- `val unlockInvalidSchedule: Boolean`: RFID-triggered Unlock event with 'invalid schedule' error.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OnOffTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OnOffTrait.Attributes ---
# OnOffTrait.Attributes
`interface OnOffTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the OnOff cluster. Known subclass: `OnOff`.
### Properties
- `val acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
- `val attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
- `val clusterRevision: UShort`: Server cluster specification revision.
- `val featureMap: OnOffTrait.Feature`: Bitmap of supported optional cluster features.
- `val generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
- `val globalSceneControl: Boolean?`: If true, prevents global scene from being destroyed by `on`/`off` commands. (Read access)
- `val offWaitTime: UShort?`: Time (in 0.1s) `onOff` is false before another `OnWithTimedOff` is allowed. (Write access)
- `val onOff: Boolean?`: Whether the device is on (true) or off (false). (Read access)
- `val onTime: UShort?`: Time (in 0.1s) `onOff` is true before changing to false when using `OnWithTimedOff`. (Write access)
- `val startUpOnOff: OnOffTrait.StartUpOnOffEnum?`: Desired startup behavior when power is supplied. (Write access)

# `Descriptor`
API for the Descriptor trait, which provides an interface for describing the device's capabilities and configuration.
### Nested Types
- `enum Descriptor.Attribute`: Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
### Functions
- `supports(attribute: Descriptor.Attribute): Boolean`
### Properties
- `factory`: `open TraitFactory<Descriptor>`
- `acceptedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of client-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
- `attributeList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs of the attributes supported by the cluster instance.
- `clientList`: `List<UInt>?` - A list of cluster IDs for the client clusters present on the endpoint.
- `clusterRevision`: `UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
- `deviceTypeList`: `List<DescriptorTrait.DeviceTypeStruct>?` - A list of device types and revisions to declare endpoint conformance.
- `featureMap`: `DescriptorTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands which are supported by this cluster server instance.
- `partsList`: `List<UShort>?` - The composition of the device type instance, including the endpoints in this list.
- `serverList`: `List<UInt>?` - A list of cluster IDs for the server clusters present on the endpoint.
- `tagList`: `List<DescriptorTrait.SemanticTagStruct>?` - A list of tags used for disambiguating and providing information about endpoints.
- `metadata`: `Trait.TraitMetadata`

- `forceRead(): suspend Unit` - From `com.google.home.TraitStateInvalidation`.

# `ColorControlTrait.StopMoveStepCommand`
An object that stops a `MoveTo`, `Move`, or `Step` command that is currently in process. The `currentHue`, `enhancedCurrentHue`, and `currentSaturation` attributes are left at their present value, and `remainingTime` is set to `0`.

- `airQuality`: `AirQualityTrait.AirQualityEnum?` - The currently measured air quality.
- `attributeList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
- `clusterRevision`: `UShort` - The revision of the server cluster specification supported by the cluster instance.
- `featureMap`: `AirQualityTrait.Feature` - Whether the server supports zero or more optional cluster features.
- `generatedCommandList`: `List<UInt>` - A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster server instance.

- `heating`: `Boolean` - Thermostat is capable of managing a heating device.

- `matterScheduleConfiguration`: `Boolean` - Supports enhanced schedules.
- `occupancy`: `Boolean` - Supports occupied and unoccupied setpoints.
- `presets`: `Boolean` - Supports setpoint presets.

# ColorControlTrait
`object ColorControlTrait`
Attributes for ColorControlTrait.
### Nested types
- `interface Attributes`: Attributes for the ColorControl cluster.
- `data class ColorCapabilitiesBitmap`: The color capabilities that the device supports.
- `enum ColorLoopActionEnum`: The action to take for a color loop.
- `enum ColorLoopDirectionEnum`: The direction for an attribute on a circular scale.
- `object ColorLoopSetCommand`: Cycles the device through its range of hues.
- `class ColorLoopSetCommand.Request`: Request payload for the ColorLoopSet command.
- `enum ColorModeEnum`
- `enum DirectionEnum`: The direction in which to change an attribute whose values are arranged in a circle.
- `enum DriftCompensationEnum`: How drift compensation is implemented.
- `enum EnhancedColorModeEnum`: How enhanced color mode is specified.
- `object EnhancedMoveHueCommand`: Change a device's enhanced hue based on a rate of movement.
- `class EnhancedMoveHueCommand.Request`: Request payload for the EnhancedMoveHue command.
- `object EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationCommand`: Move a device from its current enhanced hue and saturation to the provided enhanced hue and saturation.
- `class EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationCommand.Request`: Request payload for the EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturation command.
- `object EnhancedMoveToHueCommand`: Move a device from its current hue to the provided enhanced hue.
- `class EnhancedMoveToHueCommand.Request`: Request payload for the EnhancedMoveToHue command.
- `object EnhancedStepHueCommand`: Move a device's enhanced hue a specific amount over a period of time.
- `class EnhancedStepHueCommand.Request`: Request payload for the EnhancedStepHue command.
- `data class Feature`: ColorControl cluster FeatureMap.
- `object MoveColorCommand`: Move a device from its current color in a continuous fashion according to the rates specified.
- `class MoveColorCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveColor command.
- `object MoveColorTemperatureCommand`: Change a device's color temperature based on a rate of movement.
- `class MoveColorTemperatureCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveColorTemperature command.
- `object MoveHueCommand`: Change a device's hue based on a rate of movement.
- `class MoveHueCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveHue command.
- `enum MoveModeEnum`: Move mode values.
- `object MoveSaturationCommand`: Change a device's saturation based on a rate of movement.
- `class MoveSaturationCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveSaturation command.
- `object MoveToColorCommand`: Move a device from its current color to the color given in the `colorX` and `colorY` parameters.
- `class MoveToColorCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveToColor command.
- `object MoveToColorTemperatureCommand`: Move a device from its current color to a new color, using the scaled inverse of the color temperature, in mireds.
- `class MoveToColorTemperatureCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveToColorTemperature command.
- `object MoveToHueAndSaturationCommand`: Move a device from its current hue and saturation to the provided hue and saturation.
- `class MoveToHueAndSaturationCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveToHueAndSaturation command.
- `object MoveToHueCommand`: Move a device from its current hue to the provided hue.
- `class MoveToHueCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveToHue command.
- `object MoveToSaturationCommand`: Move a device from its current saturation to the provided saturation.
- `class MoveToSaturationCommand.Request`: Request payload for the MoveToSaturation command.
- `data class OptionsBitmap`
- `object StepColorCommand`: Move a device from its current color by the specified color step.
- `class StepColorCommand.Request`: Request payload for the StepColor command.
- `object StepColorTemperatureCommand`: Change a device's color temperature a specific amount over a period of time.
- `class StepColorTemperatureCommand.Request`: Request payload for the StepColorTemperature command.
- `object StepHueCommand`: Move a device's hue a specific amount over a period of time.
- `class StepHueCommand.Request`: Request payload for the StepHue command.
- `enum StepModeEnum`: The mode by which stepwise changes to the attribute are applied.
- `object StepSaturationCommand`: Move a device's saturation a specific amount over a period of time.
- `class StepSaturationCommand.Request`: Request payload for the StepSaturation command.
- `object StopMoveStepCommand`: Stop a MoveTo, Move, or Step command that is currently in process.
- `class StopMoveStepCommand.Request`: Request payload for the StopMoveStep command.
- `data class UpdateFlagsBitmap`: Values for ColorLoopSet.
### Public properties
- `Id: ClusterId`

- `forceRead(): suspend Unit`

- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of the attribute IDs supported by the cluster instance.
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.

# ActionsTrait.EndpointListTypeEnum

# CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement
`interface CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement : CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait`
API for the CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement trait, providing an interface to carbon dioxide concentration measurement functionality.
### Nested types
- `enum Attribute`: Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
### Public functions
- `supports(attribute: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement.Attribute): Boolean`
### Public properties
- `factory: open TraitFactory<CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurement>`
### Inherited functions
- `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
### Inherited properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
- `averageMeasuredValue: Float?`: The average value of `measuredValue` over `averageMeasuredValueWindow`.
- `averageMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: The window of time, in seconds, for `averageMeasuredValue`.
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The server cluster specification revision.
- `featureMap: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.Feature`: Optional cluster features support.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
- `levelValue: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.LevelValueEnum?`: The level of the substance detected.
- `maxMeasuredValue: Float?`: The maximum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
- `measuredValue: Float?`: The most recent measurement.
- `measurementMedium: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementMediumEnum?`: The medium being measured.
- `measurementUnit: CarbonDioxideConcentrationMeasurementTrait.MeasurementUnitEnum?`: The unit used by `measuredValue`.
- `minMeasuredValue: Float?`: The minimum value of `measuredValue` that can be measured.
- `peakMeasuredValue: Float?`: The maximum value of `measuredValue` measured during `peakMeasuredValueWindow`.
- `peakMeasuredValueWindow: UInt?`: The window of time, in seconds, for `peakMeasuredValue`.
- `uncertainty: Float?`: The range of error for `measuredValue` and `peakMeasuredValue`.
- `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.MediaPlayback ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/MediaPlayback ---
# MediaPlayback
`interface MediaPlayback : MediaPlaybackTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait, MediaPlaybackCommands`
API for the MediaPlayback trait, for controlling media playback on a device.
### Nested types
- `enum Attribute`: Descriptor enum for this trait's attributes.
- `enum Command`: Descriptor enum for this trait's commands.
### Public functions
- `supports(attribute: MediaPlayback.Attribute): Boolean`
- `supports(command: MediaPlayback.Command): Boolean`
### Public properties
- `factory: open TraitFactory<MediaPlayback>`
### Inherited functions
- `activateAudioTrack(trackId: String, audioOutputIndex: UByte): suspend Unit`
- `activateTextTrack(trackId: String): suspend Unit`
- `deactivateTextTrack(): suspend Unit`
- `fastForward(...): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.FastForwardCommand.Response`: Fast forward the current media.
- `next(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.NextCommand.Response`: Move to the next item.
- `pause(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.PauseCommand.Response`: Pause the current media.
- `play(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.PlayCommand.Response`: Play the current media.
- `previous(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.PreviousCommand.Response`: Move to the previous item.
- `rewind(...): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.RewindCommand.Response`: Rewind the current media.
- `seek(position: ULong): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.SeekCommand.Response`: Change the playback position.
- `skipBackward(deltaPositionMilliseconds: ULong): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.SkipBackwardCommand.Response`: Skip backward by a specified amount of time.
- `skipForward(deltaPositionMilliseconds: ULong): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.SkipForwardCommand.Response`: Skip forward by a specified amount of time.
- `startOver(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.StartOverCommand.Response`: Start over from the beginning.
- `stop(): suspend MediaPlaybackTrait.StopCommand.Response`: Stop playing the current media.
- `forceRead(): suspend Unit`
- *(Batchable versions of all commands also available)*
### Inherited properties
- `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported client-generated commands.
- `activeAudioTrack: MediaPlaybackTrait.TrackStruct?`
- `activeTextTrack: MediaPlaybackTrait.TrackStruct?`
- `attributeList: List<UInt>`: List of supported attribute IDs.
- `availableAudioTracks: List<MediaPlaybackTrait.TrackStruct>?`
- `availableTextTracks: List<MediaPlaybackTrait.TrackStruct>?`
- `clusterRevision: UShort`: The server cluster specification revision.
- `currentState: MediaPlaybackTrait.PlaybackStateEnum?`: The current playback state of media.
- `duration: ULong?`: The duration of the media in milliseconds.
- `featureMap: MediaPlaybackTrait.Feature`: Optional cluster features support.
- `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: List of supported server-generated commands.
- `playbackSpeed: Float?`: The speed at which the current media is being played.
- `sampledPosition: MediaPlaybackTrait.PlaybackPositionStruct?`: The position of playback as of the specified time.
- `seekRangeEnd: ULong?`: The furthest forward valid seek position in milliseconds.
- `seekRangeStart: ULong?`: The earliest valid seek position in milliseconds.
- `startTime: ULong?`: The start time of the media in UTC format.
- `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationCommand.Request ---
# ColorControlTrait.EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationCommand.Request
`class ColorControlTrait.EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationCommand.Request`
Request payload for the EnhancedMoveToHueAndSaturation command.
### Public constructors
- `Request(enhancedHue: UShort, saturation: UByte, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`
### Public properties
- `enhancedHue: UShort`: The enhanced hue to be moved to (`0` to `65534`).
- `optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Determines which bits in `options` should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
- `optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap`: Overrides bits in `options` if the corresponding bit in `optionsMask` is `1`.
- `saturation: UByte`: The saturation to be moved to (`0` to `254`).
- `transitionTime: UShort`: The time (in 0.1s) to move to the new enhanced hue and saturation.

# DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.OptOutStateEnum
`enum DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.OptOutStateEnum`
The opt-out state of the ESA.
### Enum Values
- **`GridOptOut`**: The user has opted out of grid EMS optimizations only.
- **`LocalOptOut`**: The user has opted out of local EMS optimizations only.

- **`OptOut`**: The user has opted out of all external optimizations.

# DoorLockTrait.DlCredentialRuleMask
`data class DoorLockTrait.DlCredentialRuleMask`
Credential rules.
### Public Constructor
- `DlCredentialRuleMask(single: Boolean = false, dual: Boolean = false, tri: Boolean = false)`
### Public Properties
- **`bitmapName`**: `String` - Name of the Matter bitmap, in UpperCamelCase.
- **`dual`**: `Boolean` - Two credentials are required to operate the lock.
- **`single`**: `Boolean` - One credential is required to operate the lock.
- **`traitId`**: `String` - Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster that defines the bitmap Data Type.
- **`tri`**: `Boolean` - Three credentials are required to operate the lock.
### Public Functions
- `toRaw(): open ULong` - Convert this ClusterBitmap to raw (bytes) format.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CauseEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CauseEnum ---
# DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CauseEnum
`enum DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CauseEnum`
The cause of the request from the EMS.
### Enum Values
- **`Cancelled`**: The adjustment was cancelled by the EMS.
- **`Fault`**: The ESA has developed a fault and could not complete the adjustment.
- **`NormalCompletion`**: The ESA completed the power adjustment as requested.
- **`Offline`**: The ESA was set to `offline`.
- **`UnknownValue`**: The enum value is out of range.
- **`UserOptOut`**: The user has disabled the ESA's flexibility capability.
### Public Functions
- `valueOf(value: String): DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CauseEnum`
- `values(): Array<DeviceEnergyManagementTrait.CauseEnum>`
### Public Properties
- **`traitId`**: `open String`
- **`typeName`**: `open String`
- **`value`**: `open ULong`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlTrait.MoveToSaturationCommand.Request ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlTrait.MoveToSaturationCommand.Request ---
# ColorControlTrait.MoveToSaturationCommand.Request
`class ColorControlTrait.MoveToSaturationCommand.Request`
The request payload for the MoveToSaturation command.
### Public Constructor
- `Request(saturation: UByte, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap(), optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap = OptionsBitmap())`
### Public Properties
- **`optionsMask`**: `ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Determines which bits in the `options` attribute should be overridden by `optionsOverride`.
- **`optionsOverride`**: `ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap` - Overrides the corresponding bit in `options` attribute if the bit in `optionsMask` is 1.
- **`saturation`**: `UByte` - The saturation to be moved to (range 0-254).
- **`transitionTime`**: `UShort` - The time (in 0.1 seconds) to move to the new saturation.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OnOff ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OnOff ---
# OnOff
`interface OnOff : OnOffTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait, Updatable, OnOffCommands`
API for the OnOff trait, providing an interface for turning devices on and off.
### Nested types
*   `enum OnOff.Attribute`: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum OnOff.Command`: Descriptor for this trait's commands.
### Public functions
*   `supports(attribute: OnOff.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: OnOff.Command): Boolean`
### Public properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<OnOff>`
### Inherited functions
*   **From `OnOffCommands`**:
    *   `suspend off(): Unit`: Turn off the device.
    *   `offBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   `suspend offWithEffect(effectIdentifier: OnOffTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum, effectVariant: UByte): Unit`: Turn off with fading effects.
    *   `offWithEffectBatchable(...)`
    *   `suspend on(): Unit`: Turn on the device.
    *   `onBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
    *   `suspend onWithRecallGlobalScene(): Unit`: Recall global scene settings.
    *   `onWithRecallGlobalSceneBatchable()`
    *   `suspend onWithTimedOff(onOffControl: OnOffTrait.OnOffControlBitmap, onTime: UShort, offWaitTime: UShort): Unit`: Turn on for a specific duration.
    *   `onWithTimedOffBatchable(...)`
    *   `suspend toggle(): Unit`: Toggle the on/off state.
    *   `toggleBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
*   **From `TraitStateInvalidation`**:
    *   `suspend forceRead(): Unit`
*   **From `Updatable`**:
    *   `suspend update(...): OnOff`: Creates and saves a mutable copy of the object.
### Inherited properties
*   **From `OnOffTrait.Attributes`**:
    *   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported client-generated commands.
    *   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: Supported attribute IDs.
    *   `clusterRevision: UShort`: Cluster specification revision.
    *   `featureMap: OnOffTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
    *   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported server-generated commands.
    *   `globalSceneControl: Boolean?`: Prevents global scene destruction by `on`/`off` commands.
    *   `offWaitTime: UShort?`: Time (in 0.1s) `onOff` is false before another `OnWithTimedOff` is allowed.
    *   `onOff: Boolean?`: Whether the device is on (true) or off (false).
    *   `onTime: UShort?`: Time (in 0.1s) `onOff` is true when using `OnWithTimedOff`.
    *   `startUpOnOff: OnOffTrait.StartUpOnOffEnum?`: Desired startup behavior on power-up.
*   **From `Trait`**:
    *   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.UnitTesting ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/UnitTesting ---
# UnitTesting
`interface UnitTesting : UnitTestingTrait.Attributes, MatterTrait, Updatable, UnitTestingCommands`
API for the UnitTesting trait, a cluster used for testing purposes.
### Nested types
*   `enum UnitTesting.Attribute`: Descriptor for attributes.
*   `enum UnitTesting.Command`: Descriptor for commands.
### Public functions
*   `supports(attribute: UnitTesting.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: UnitTesting.Command): Boolean`
### Public properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<UnitTesting>`
### Inherited functions
*   **From `UnitTestingCommands`**: Includes various test commands like `globalEchoRequest`, `simpleStructEchoRequest`, `testAddArguments`, `testComplexNullableOptionalRequest`, `testListInt8UArgumentRequest`, `testNotHandled`, `testSpecific`, etc., along with their batchable versions.
*   **From `TraitStateInvalidation`**:
    *   `suspend forceRead(): Unit`
*   **From `Updatable`**:
    *   `suspend update(...): UnitTesting`
### Inherited properties
*   **From `UnitTestingTrait.Attributes`**: Includes a comprehensive list of test attributes of various types (boolean, integer, string, enum, struct, list, bitmap, etc.), both nullable and non-nullable. Examples: `boolean`, `int8u`, `charString`, `enumAttr`, `structAttr`, `listInt8u`, `nullableBoolean`.
*   **From `Trait`**:
    *   `metadata: Trait.TraitMetadata`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.OnOffCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/OnOffCommands ---
# OnOffCommands
`interface OnOffCommands`
Known direct subclasses: `OnOff`.
### Public functions
*   `suspend off(): Unit`: Turns off the device, setting `onOff` to false.
*   `offBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
*   `suspend offWithEffect(effectIdentifier: OnOffTrait.EffectIdentifierEnum, effectVariant: UByte): Unit`: Turns off using an enhanced fading effect.
*   `offWithEffectBatchable(...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
*   `suspend on(): Unit`: Turns on the device, setting `onOff` to true.
*   `onBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
*   `suspend onWithRecallGlobalScene(): Unit`: Recalls global scene settings from when the device was turned off.
*   `onWithRecallGlobalSceneBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
*   `suspend onWithTimedOff(onOffControl: OnOffTrait.OnOffControlBitmap, onTime: UShort, offWaitTime: UShort): Unit`: Turns on for a specific duration with a guarded off period.
*   `onWithTimedOffBatchable(...): BatchableCommand<Unit>`
*   `suspend toggle(): Unit`: Toggles the on/off state of the device.
*   `toggleBatchable(): BatchableCommand<Unit>`

*   `object ClearHolidayScheduleCommand`: Clears a holiday schedule.
*   `object ClearUserCommand`: Clears a specified user.
*   `object ClearWeekDayScheduleCommand`: Clears a week day schedule.
*   `object ClearYearDayScheduleCommand`: Clears a year day schedule.

*   `enum LockOperationTypeEnum`: Type of lock operation.
*   `interface LockUserChange`: A lock user, schedule, or credential has changed.
*   `enum OperatingModeEnum`, `enum OperationErrorEnum`, `enum OperationSourceEnum`: Operating modes, errors, and sources.
*   `object SetAliroReaderConfigCommand`, `SetCredentialCommand`, `SetHolidayScheduleCommand`, `SetUserCommand`, `SetWeekDayScheduleCommand`, `SetYearDayScheduleCommand`: Commands to configure the lock.
*   `enum UserStatusEnum`, `enum UserTypeEnum`: User status and type.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.LaundryWasherModeTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/LaundryWasherModeTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface LaundryWasherModeTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the LaundryWasherMode cluster.
#### Public properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of client-generated commands supported by this cluster.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: A list of attribute IDs supported by the cluster.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The revision of the server cluster specification.
*   `currentMode: UByte?`: The current mode. Must be one of the values in `supportedModes`. (Access: Read)
*   `featureMap: LaundryWasherModeTrait.Feature`: Indicates support for optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: A list of server-generated commands supported by this cluster.
*   `onMode: UByte?`: The value of `currentMode` that depends on the state of an `OnOff` cluster. (Access: Write)
*   `startUpMode: UByte?`: The desired startup mode for the device when powered on. (Access: Write)
*   `supportedModes: List<LaundryWasherModeTrait.ModeOptionStruct>?`: The list of supported modes. (Access: Read)
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.DoorLockTrait.DoorLockOperationEventCode ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/DoorLockTrait.DoorLockOperationEventCode ---
### `enum DoorLockTrait.DoorLockOperationEventCode`
Door lock operation event codes.
#### Enum Values
*   `AutoLock`: Automatic lock.
*   `KeyLock`: Key lock.
*   `KeyUnlock`: Key unlock.
*   `Lock`: Lock.
*   `LockInvalidPinOrId`: Invalid credential provided when attempting to lock.
*   `LockInvalidSchedule`: Invalid lock schedule.
*   `ManualLock`: Manual lock.
*   `ManualUnlock`: Manual unlock.
*   `OneTouchLock`: One touch lock.
*   `ScheduleLock`: Schedule lock.
*   `ScheduleUnlock`: Schedule unlock.
*   `UnknownOrMfgSpecific`: Unknown or manufacturer-specific event.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
*   `Unlock`: Unlock.
*   `UnlockInvalidPinOrId`: Invalid credential provided when attempting to unlock.
*   `UnlockInvalidSchedule`: Invalid unlock schedule.
#### Public properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ThermostatTrait.AcCompressorTypeEnum ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ThermostatTrait.AcCompressorTypeEnum ---
### `enum ThermostatTrait.AcCompressorTypeEnum`
Types of compressor.
#### Enum Values
*   `T1`: Compressor with a max working ambient temperature of 43 °C.
*   `T2`: Compressor with a max working ambient temperature of 35 °C.
*   `T3`: Compressor with a max working ambient temperature of 52 °C.
*   `Unknown`: Unknown compressor type.
*   `UnknownValue`: The enum value is out of range.
#### Public properties
*   `traitId: String`: Trait identifier of the Matter Cluster.
*   `typeName: String`: Name of the Matter Data Type.
*   `value: ULong`: Integer identifier of the enum value.

### `class ThermostatTrait.SetpointRaiseLowerCommand.Request`

#### Constructor
*   `Request(mode: ThermostatTrait.SetpointRaiseLowerModeEnum, amount: Byte)`
#### Properties

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.CastingVideoClientDevice ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/CastingVideoClientDevice ---
### `class CastingVideoClientDevice`
A device that can launch content on a remote device, like a smart speaker or phone app. It inherits from `DeviceType`.
#### Constructor
*   `CastingVideoClientDevice(metadata: DeviceType.Metadata, traitProvider: TraitProvider, eventProvider: HasEvents)`
#### Public properties
*   `factory: DeviceTypeFactory<CastingVideoClientDevice>`
*   `metadata: DeviceType.Metadata`
#### Inherited Functionality
*   From `HasEvents`: Provides `events()` to get a flow of all or specific events.
*   From `TraitProvider`: Provides `trait()` to access a specific trait and `traits()` to get all available traits.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.EnergyEvseCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/EnergyEvseCommands ---
### `interface EnergyEvseCommands`
Commands for the EnergyEvse trait.
#### Public functions
*   `suspend fun clearTargets()`: Clears all stored charging targets.
*   `fun clearTargetsBatchable()`: Batchable version of `clearTargets`.
*   `suspend fun disable()`: Disables the EVSE from charging and discharging.
*   `fun disableBatchable()`: Batchable version of `disable`.
*   `suspend fun enableCharging(chargingEnabledUntil: UInt?, minimumChargeCurrent: Long, maximumChargeCurrent: Long)`: Enables the EVSE to charge an EV.
*   `fun enableChargingBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `enableCharging`.
*   `suspend fun enableDischarging(dischargingEnabledUntil: UInt?, maximumDischargeCurrent: Long)`: Enables the EVSE to discharge an EV.
*   `fun enableDischargingBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `enableDischarging`.
*   `suspend fun getTargets(): Response`: Retrieves the current set of charging targets.
*   `fun getTargetsBatchable()`: Batchable version of `getTargets`.
*   `suspend fun setTargets(chargingTargetSchedules: List<EnergyEvseTrait.ChargingTargetScheduleStruct>)`: Sets user-specified charging targets.
*   `fun setTargetsBatchable(...)`: Batchable version of `setTargets`.
*   `suspend fun startDiagnostics()`: Puts the EVSE into self-diagnostics mode.
*   `fun startDiagnosticsBatchable()`: Batchable version of `startDiagnostics`.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.WindowCoveringTrait.Attributes ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/WindowCoveringTrait.Attributes ---
### `interface WindowCoveringTrait.Attributes`
Attributes for the WindowCovering cluster.
#### Public properties
*   `acceptedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported client-generated commands.
*   `attributeList: List<UInt>`: Supported attribute IDs.
*   `clusterRevision: UShort`: The cluster specification revision.
*   `configStatus: WindowCoveringTrait.ConfigStatus?`
*   `currentPositionLift: UShort?`: Distance from fully-open position, in cm. (Access: Read)
*   `currentPositionLiftPercent100ths: UShort?`: Position as a percentage with 0.01% step. (Access: Read)
*   `currentPositionLiftPercentage: UByte?`: Position as a percentage with 1% step. (Access: Read)
*   `currentPositionTilt: UShort?`: Current tilt position, in degrees. (Access: Read)
*   `currentPositionTiltPercent100ths: UShort?`: Tilt position as a percentage with 0.01% step. (Access: Read)
*   `currentPositionTiltPercentage: UByte?`: Tilt position as a percentage with 1% step. (Access: Read)
*   `endProductType: WindowCoveringTrait.EndProductType?`
*   `featureMap: WindowCoveringTrait.Feature`: Supported optional cluster features.
*   `generatedCommandList: List<UInt>`: Supported server-generated commands.
*   `installedClosedLimitLift: UShort?`: Closed limit for tilting, in tenths of a degree. (Access: Read)
*   `installedClosedLimitTilt: UShort?`: Closed limit for lifting, in tenths of a degree. (Access: Read)
*   `installedOpenLimitLift: UShort?`: Open limit for lifting, in cm. (Access: Read)
*   `installedOpenLimitTilt: UShort?`: Open limit for tilting, in tenths of a degree. (Access: Read)
*   `mode: WindowCoveringTrait.Mode?`
*   `numberOfActuationsLift: UShort?`: Total lift/slide actuations since installation. (Access: Read)
*   `numberOfActuationsTilt: UShort?`: Total tilt actuations since installation. (Access: Read)
*   `operationalStatus: WindowCoveringTrait.OperationalStatus?`
*   `physicalClosedLimitLift: UShort?`: Max encoder position for height, in cm. (Access: Read)
*   `physicalClosedLimitTilt: UShort?`: Max encoder position for angle. (Access: Read)
*   `safetyStatus: WindowCoveringTrait.SafetyStatus?`
*   `targetPositionLiftPercent100ths: UShort?`: Target lift position as a percentage. (Access: Read)
*   `targetPositionTiltPercent100ths: UShort?`: Target tilt position as a percentage. (Access: Read)
*   `type: WindowCoveringTrait.Type?`

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.PressureMeasurement ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/PressureMeasurement ---
### `interface PressureMeasurement`
API for the PressureMeasurement trait, providing an interface to pressure measurement functionality.
#### Nested types
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
#### Public functions
*   `supports(attribute: PressureMeasurement.Attribute): Boolean`
#### Public properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<PressureMeasurement>`
#### Inherited Attributes
*   `measuredValue: Short?`: Pressure in kPa (10x the value).
*   `minMeasuredValue: Short?`: Minimum measurable pressure value.
*   `maxMeasuredValue: Short?`: Maximum measurable pressure value.
*   `tolerance: UShort?`: Possible error range for `measuredValue`.
*   `scaledValue: Short?`: Pressure in Pascals, calculated with `scale`.
*   `minScaledValue: Short?`: Minimum measurable `scaledValue`.
*   `maxScaledValue: Short?`: Maximum measurable `scaledValue`.
*   `scaledTolerance: UShort?`: Possible error range for `scaledValue`.
*   `scale: Byte?`: Base 10 exponent for calculating `scaledValue`.
--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.MediaInput ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/MediaInput ---
### `interface MediaInput`
API for the MediaInput trait, used for controlling the input selector on a media device.
#### Nested types
*   `enum Attribute`: Descriptor for this trait's attributes.
*   `enum Command`: Descriptor for this trait's commands.
#### Public functions
*   `supports(attribute: MediaInput.Attribute): Boolean`
*   `supports(command: MediaInput.Command): Boolean`
#### Public properties
*   `factory: TraitFactory<MediaInput>`
#### Inherited Commands
*   `hideInputStatus()`: Hide the input list on the display.
*   `renameInput(index: UByte, name: String)`: Change the name of the specified input.
*   `selectInput(index: UByte)`: Change the media input on the device.
*   `showInputStatus()`: Show the input list on the display.
*   (Batchable versions of all commands are also available).
#### Inherited Attributes
*   `inputList: List<MediaInputTrait.InputInfoStruct>?`: A list of media inputs supported by the device.
*   `currentInput: UByte?`: The index of the currently selected input.

- `Fuchsia`: Fuchsia.

- `Navy`: Navy.

- `Olive`: Olive.
- `Purple`: Purple.

- `Silver`: Silver.
- `Teal`: Teal.

- `Yellow`: Yellow.

--- package: com.google.home.matter.standard.ColorControlCommands ---
--- source: https://developers.home.google.com/reference/kotlin/com/google/home/matter/standard/ColorControlCommands ---
# interface ColorControlCommands
### Public functions
- `suspend fun colorLoopSet(updateFlags: ColorControlTrait.UpdateFlagsBitmap, action: ColorControlTrait.ColorLoopActionEnum, direction: ColorControlTrait.ColorLoopDirectionEnum, time: UShort, startHue: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Cycles the device through its range of hues.
- `fun colorLoopSetBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `colorLoopSet` command.
- `suspend fun enhancedMoveHue(moveMode: ColorControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Change a device's enhanced hue based on a rate of movement.
- `fun enhancedMoveHueBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `enhancedMoveHue` command.
- `suspend fun enhancedMoveToHue(enhancedHue: UShort, direction: ColorControlTrait.DirectionEnum, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current hue to the provided enhanced hue.
- `fun enhancedMoveToHueBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `enhancedMoveToHue` command.
- `suspend fun enhancedMoveToHueAndSaturation(enhancedHue: UShort, saturation: UByte, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current enhanced hue and saturation to the provided enhanced hue and saturation.
- `fun enhancedMoveToHueAndSaturationBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `enhancedMoveToHueAndSaturation` command.
- `suspend fun enhancedStepHue(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device's enhanced hue a specific amount over a period of time.
- `fun enhancedStepHueBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `enhancedStepHue` command.
- `suspend fun moveColor(rateX: Short, rateY: Short, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current color in a continuous fashion according to the rates specified.
- `fun moveColorBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveColor` command.
- `suspend fun moveColorTemperature(moveMode: ColorControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UShort, colorTemperatureMinimumMireds: UShort, colorTemperatureMaximumMireds: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Change a device's color temperature based on a rate of movement.
- `fun moveColorTemperatureBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveColorTemperature` command.
- `suspend fun moveHue(moveMode: ColorControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Change a device's hue based on a rate of movement.
- `fun moveHueBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveHue` command.
- `suspend fun moveSaturation(moveMode: ColorControlTrait.MoveModeEnum, rate: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Change a device's saturation based on a rate of movement.
- `fun moveSaturationBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveSaturation` command.
- `suspend fun moveToColor(colorX: UShort, colorY: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current color to the color given in the `colorX` and `colorY` parameters.
- `fun moveToColorBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveToColor` command.
- `suspend fun moveToColorTemperature(colorTemperatureMireds: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current color to a new color, using the scaled inverse of the color temperature, in mireds.
- `fun moveToColorTemperatureBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveToColorTemperature` command.
- `suspend fun moveToHue(hue: UByte, direction: ColorControlTrait.DirectionEnum, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current hue to the provided hue.
- `fun moveToHueBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveToHue` command.
- `suspend fun moveToHueAndSaturation(hue: UByte, saturation: UByte, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current hue and saturation to the provided hue and saturation.
- `fun moveToHueAndSaturationBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveToHueAndSaturation` command.
- `suspend fun moveToSaturation(saturation: UByte, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current saturation to the provided saturation.
- `fun moveToSaturationBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `moveToSaturation` command.
- `suspend fun stepColor(stepX: Short, stepY: Short, transitionTime: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device from its current color by the specified color step.
- `fun stepColorBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `stepColor` command.
- `suspend fun stepColorTemperature(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UShort, transitionTime: UShort, colorTemperatureMinimumMireds: UShort, colorTemperatureMaximumMireds: UShort, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Change a device's color temperature a specific amount over a period of time.
- `fun stepColorTemperatureBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `stepColorTemperature` command.
- `suspend fun stepHue(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, transitionTime: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device's hue a specific amount over a period of time.
- `fun stepHueBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `stepHue` command.
- `suspend fun stepSaturation(stepMode: ColorControlTrait.StepModeEnum, stepSize: UByte, transitionTime: UByte, optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Move a device's saturation a specific amount over a period of time.
- `fun stepSaturationBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `stepSaturation` command.
- `suspend fun stopMoveStep(optionsMask: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap, optionsOverride: ColorControlTrait.OptionsBitmap)`: Stop a MoveTo, Move, or Step command that is currently in process.
- `fun stopMoveStepBatchable(...)`: The batchable version of `stopMoveStep` command.
